(You drank a wineglass to the bottom).{***}
Wonderful mead! (You do like this drink){***}
Yes. Meadbrewer produced delicious mead with kalyna berries.{***}
Kalyna? What it is?{***}
I do not know. (Silberfalke smiles). You should ask Meadbrewer.{***}
I circuited  the tawn in order to find you.  I have never seen Meadbrewer.{***}
Meadbrewer is a retired mercenary guild of adventurers. We traveled Perisno together for a while.{***}
Where can I find Meadbrewer?{***}
You can find Meadbrewer at the tavern of {s8}.{***}
I failed the quest.{***}
That is a shame. You can come back next time for more quests, however.{***}
I found the client and did what was required.{***}
I found the client and did what was required.{***}
Greetings Meadbrewer! My name is {playername}. Do you sell mead?{***}
Yes, but only to my friends.{***}
I drank your mead with kalyna berries. What it kalyna? Silberfalke told me to ask you.{***}
Silberfalke?{***}
Yes. The armorer from Fountain Hall.{***}
Kalyna is a common name for guelder-rose. Kalyna is one of the national symbols of my homeland. Its berries symbolize blood and the undying trace of family roots.{***}
Silberfalke said you were together in the Adventurer Guild.{***}

Yes. Silberfalke returned to his relatives in the city. He is a skilled gunsmith. I stayed here.  Around grow prairie grass. Near the lake grows guelder-rose. It is a paradise for bees and mead-brewers.{***}
Can you help me make some aurums?{***}
You should rather ask my former colleagues about this. Their quests will bring you a lot of gold.{***}
Okay, I'll find them.{***}
Mead you do not sell. How do you make for a living?{***}
You must find other adventurers.{***}
Okay, I'll find them.{***}
Wait a minute. Let me see if I have anything for you.{***}
Okay. I'll wait.{***}
The client lives in {s8}. Just tell them I sent you to help.{***}
Ha! Just got the message. This problem decided patrol.{***}
Yes. That was me.{***}
Well, I'm a little bit busy now, so maybe next time...{***}
Well, here I am at you service. For a price, of course.{***}

A party of suspicious types is wandering nearby. A few town residents already disappeared.  The same thing happened to several merchant caravans, and traders now prefer to stay away from the town. Help us and rid us of those types!{***}
Ha! Just got the message. This problem decided patrol.{***}
Where are they now?{***}
Not far from the town.{***}
You've been causing a lot of trouble around here and I don't have to answer to you. Surrender or die!{***}
You've been causing a lot of trouble around here and  I don't have to answer to you. Surrender or die!{***}
Too bad. No one needs your help at the moment.{***}
Alegra-me vê-l{o/a} aqui, {playername}. {s43}
I have defeated the rebel peasants and taken back the money!{***}

Good work. Now, hand me the money and we will split it half and half. I will be leaving this town shortly, now that my work is done. You will find my colleagues throughout taverns in Perisno, giving you quests, although not every one of them will be as easy as this one! Farewell, {playername}. I can see a brave warrior in you.{***}
Hello. I am {playername}. Who are the Adventurer's Guild?{***}
Greetings. What business having you with the Adventurer's Guild? Have you come looking for tasks to complete?{***}

I am glad you asked! We are a group of men and women dedicated to getting beginning adventurers started on their journeys to become famous. We give out tasks, quests, and jobs of all sorts to people who want it and if those in need request a favor we will try to send an Adventurer to help them. Of course, we require payment from the ones who request help from us.{***}
So basically you guys are a group of people that send your guildsman to help those in need, if paid?{***}

Essentially, yes. Although we occasionally send mercenaries to help as well. It is a very fair system, I think. Pay us to help you, and we will pay mercenaries or our guildsman to go help. That way, everyone ends up happy. Are you looking for any tasks to complete, adventurer?{***}
I am a mercenary in these lands. I indeed would like to complete some quests.{***}
No. Goodbye for now.{***}

I was hoping you would ask. I don't know how capable you are, but since you are new, I will give you an easier job. Recently, we were contacted by an anonymous village elder who told us that a group of rebel peasants - around 10 or 20 have rioted and escaped from the village. They are now fugitives, and are told to be around this town. We want you to hunt these peasants down and defeat them, then take their money that they stole from the village elder and give it to us so we can return it to the elder.{***}
I will do it.{***}
No thanks. I don't have time right now.{***}
Very good. Once you defeat the rebellious farmers, return to me and I shall give you a reward as well. Good luck, {playername}.{***}
Who are you? What do you want here? I warn you ... we ... we know how to use our weapons!{***}
What a bunch of fools! I thought you would at least prove a challenge of some sort. I have come to kill you and take back your money that you stole from your village's treasuries.{***}
Men ... steady! We shall let no one get in our way of freedom!{***}
Do you have any tasks for me?{***}

Actually, yes. A while ago, a mysterious stranger approached me, telling me to look out for any adventurer who was up for a hard task, and giving me a chest of gold as a reward for the one who would complete it. Might you be up for it?{***}
I don't see why not.{***}
It's about getting rid of someone...a woman.{***}
How is this difficult? You could hire some of Ral D'Aiun's assassins.{***}
They already made five attempts but haven't been successfull. The name of that woman is Nadriela Zwiebel - a Naphali.{***}
Umm... am I supposed to know that name?{***}

It might ring a bell. Nadriela was the leader of a contingent of rangers back in the War of the Woods. She is very famous - a legend among the Naphali and Tolranians. I was told that she killed the son of the Tolranian spymaster in a skirmish, which made him hate her.{***}
So you want me to get rid of her?{***}

Yes. However, the Tolranian Spymaster is also hunting her, so you must be careful. I had specific instructions that the Spymaster must not be the one to kill her. I do not know why this is, but the person made it seem vital.{***}
Okay. Do you know where Nadriela is right now?{***}
The person told me that she would be near Elsinore. Good luck, adventurer.{***}
No thanks.{***}
There are no more quests available for you right now. Come back to me later.{***}
Who are adventurer's guild again?{***}

I am glad you asked! We are a group of men and women dedicated to getting beginning adventurers started on their journeys to become famous. We give out tasks, quests, and jobs of all sorts to people who want it and if those in need request a favor we will try to send an Adventurer to help them. Of course, we require payment from the ones who request help from us.{***}
Ah, yes. Thanks for clearing that up for me.{***}
Never mind.{***}
Greetings, {playername}.{***}
Can you tell me a bit about yourself?{***}
I need to be going now. Farewell.{***}
I have not managed to defeat Kalrind. I am sorry.{***}
Oh well. I guess I will need someone else to do it, then. I am glad that you were not killed - Kalrind is tough! Good luck, {playername}.{***}
I have defeated Kalrind!{***}
Congratulations, {playername}. You have done the kingdom of Elintor - and me a huge favor! Here is your reward.{***}
Greetings. Who might you be?{***}
Me? I am Ulthidir, a minor noble of the Elintoran Nation. What is it you need?{***}
I am {playername}. Can you tell me a bit more about yourself?{***}

I fought in the battle of Lille's Claw, a few years back, young {reg33?Lady:Squire}. We were fighting against a large army of the Tolranian bastards, and we held them off in the pass known as Lille's Claw. The foolish Kingsmen of the Tolranians had no shields, making them easy targets for our archers as we rained death upon our enemies. It was a good day, a day of victory and glory. I also avenged my father that day, who died in the War of the Woods. The damned Tolranians have grown too arrogant, and had forgotten how our bows can easily pierce their armor. Perhaps it is time for all of us to rally again, to drive the Tolranians entirely out of their lands. Many of us hope...{***}
I see. Very interesting. Goodbye.{***}
Do you have any tasks for me?{***}

Now that you ask, yes. I am a minor noble, and I own a small amount of land near the Geldarin forests. A word of advice, friend. When offered an estate near Geldarin territory, politely decline. I chose to govern it, and now every single day I am plagued by the damn Geldarin Naphali. There has been one group, in specific, causing more trouble than the others.{***}
I'm guessing you want me to take care of them?{***}

Yes. However, these are not your ordinary group of Geldarin Naphali. They are led by one of their nobles, Kalrind. He has an infamous reputation for massacring Naphali and Humans alike. Beware of him, when you fight him. He will not be taken down easily. {***}
Where do I find him?{***}
You will find him in the Geldarin forests. Good luck, {playername}.{***}
Never mind, then. I have other things to attend to first.{***}
Nothing. Farewell.{***}
Who are you?{***}
Me? I am {playername}, and I have come to kill you!{***}
Have you, now? Well, let's see about that!{***}
Ah, good for you to come. Now, you have done us a great service, defeating Kunika. I believe, before we move on to other affairs, that that will need to be addressed. Here is your reward.{***}
Thank you. Now, I have a question. Why were you following me?{***}
Well - no offense, but I could not trust you - a mercenary to fight Kunika. I wanted to see what would happen once you fought him.{***}
So I was simply bait?{***}
Yes, unfortunately. However, I trust you now, and all the dragon priests are grateful for you. I have a request, if I may.{***}
What is it?{***}
I would like to join your party as a companion. My life has been terrible here, as a dragon priest, and I want to take a long break and explore the world. Will you take me?{***}
Of course! Pack your belongings, then, if you are joining, and meet me outside the town walls. I am honored by your offer.{***}
No, I'm sorry. I cannot take you. Goodbye.{***}
Thank you, {playername}. I shall prepare at once.{***}
Obrigado pela ajuda, {milorde/milady}. Salvou {reg1?nossas vidas:minha vida}.

{playername}, my scouts have discovered the location of the leader of the Sectarian Priests, Kunika. They say he is somewhere near Reichberg. I want your final task to be to find him and defeat him.{***}
Hmm. That is a lot to ask for. He will undoubtably be strong and have a huge army. How much will I be paid?{***}
You will be paid 15,000 aurums and you will forever have the gratitude of the Priests of the Dragon. I shall also reward you with a Wyvern mount.{***}
I shall do it.{***}
Good luck, {playername}.{***}
I will need time to prepare for this.{***}
You have been causing much grief to us, fool. You have no idea who you are messing with.{***}
I'm guessing you are Kunika? How stupid of you to come to me when I was looking for you!{***}
I will crush you and end your little life. We will become the new Dragon order.{***}
Hello again, {playername}. I assume you have come back to hear your next task?{***}
No, I'm a bit busy right now.{***}

Very well. My scouts have reported that the Sectarians are amassing in large numbers, and they have been sending scouts near Drachen lands. I would like you to hunt them down. I will pay you 1500 aurums for each group you destroy, and come back once you have defeated at least five groups.{***}
I will begin immediately.{***}
Good luck.{***}
Yes? Have you made progress?{***}
Not yet. Goodbye.{***}
I have hunted down some Sectarian Scouts.{***}
Yes, my scouts have informed me.     The reward is 1500 aurums for every Sectarian party. Here is your money, as promised.{***}

You certainly deserved your pay. Most of the Sectarian scouting parties have been dealt with and now they won't be getting so many intelligence reports. They will not anticipate us now.  You have done an excellent job.{***}
Thank you. Is there any other job for me?{***}
Yes, I will have a job for you later.{***}
Continue hunting them, {playername}. Good luck.{***}
Thank you.{***}
Obrigado pela ajuda, {milorde/milady}. As coisas realmente pareciam ruins para nós... mas então você chegou e mudou tudo.
I have succeeded in escorting the wyverns to Voldeberg.{***}
That is good to hear! One of my contacts in Voldeberg told me about you success. You didn't happen to be attacked by any Sectarian priests, did you?{***}
Actually, we were ambushed by them. We fought them off, however. {***}
The Sectarian priests are growing stronger by the day. I fear they may do something drastic soon.{***}
Is there anything else I can do to help you fight them.{***}
I will have a job for you later so come back once you are ready.{***}
I have failed. I'm sorry.{***}
I am disappointed. I thought better of you, {playername}, but apparently you cannot be trusted.{***}
Obrigado pela ajuda, {senhor/senhora}. Foi sorte tê-l{o/a} por perto.
Who are you, fool? Why have you come to me without kneeling?{***}
I am {playername}. My apologies, my Lady, I am unaware of your customs. If I may ask, who are you?{***}

Very well. I am Khivachis, one of the three High Priestesses of the Dragon in the Reich des Drachen. High Drachen Priestess Amara is my twin sister. My question still stands. Why have you come to me? {***}
My Lady, I have come seeking adventure. Might you have a task for me?{***}
I don't know. Goodbye.{***}
Someone unimportant. Goodbye.{***}

A task? Why, yes. I was just thinking about this earlier. I need a capable band of mercenaries to escort a group of my Wyvern Riders to {s8}. They are on a mission to deliver a letter to the Baron there, and they must reach their destination. Could you possibly lend a hand on this?{***}

Sure. But I have some questions. First, why are you trusting me to such an important task already, and second, can't the Wyvern Riders defend themselves? I have heard they are fearsome fighters, along with their mounts.{***}

Why am I trusting you? Well, you don't look like a spy or someone who is working for our enemies, and know that I can summon the wrath of the entire Reich and all of our dragons and dragon riders to destroy you. The Wyvern Riders can defend themselves well enough, but ... recently we have heard reports that our enemies, the Sectarian Dragon Priests, are getting stronger. We can't risk losing valuable wyverns to them.{***}
Very well. I will escort them for you.{***}
Never mind. I am too busy right now. Sorry!{***}
Perfect. The Wyvern riders will wait outside the town for you.{***}
I am afraid I don't have that many soldiers with me.{***}
Sorry. I can't do that right now{***}
Vou fazer como você disse.
Vou fazer como você disse.
Greetings. You must be our escort, right?{***}
Yes. My name is {playername}. I will lead you to {s1}.{***}
Well, It is good to know we won't travel alone. What do you want us to do now?{***}
Eh. We've made it this far... What do you want us to do?{***}
You follow my lead. I'll take you through a safe route.{***}
Alright. We'll be right behind you.{***}
You stay here for a while. I'll go ahead and check the road.{***}
Alright. We'll be waiting here for you.{***}
Well hello, traveler. What have you got with you?{***}
And who are you to ask that?{***}
Who am I? I am a dragon priest - a true dragon priest. I see you have some of your wyverm friends with you.{***}
What I do is none of your business.{***}
No need for rude words, fellow traveler. Better hand over your money and let us deal with the wyvern riders, now.{***}
I will pass, thank you. Instead I think you should hand ME your money instead.{***}
I had hoped you would be reasonable, but oh well. They're all the same ...{***}
Não se preocupe, {senhor/senhora}, estou a caminho.
What is it you want?{***}
I wish to join you and become a Grazir Worshipper.{***}
Nothing.{***}
Obrigado pela ajuda, {milorde/milady}. Esmagamos aqueles bandidos!
Ha! You think  it is that simple? If you truly wish to become one of us, you must prove that you are not some filthy spy from the Church of Faith.{***}
How do I do that?{***}

You must go on a pilgrimage to our Grazir Shrine, and see if the Priests there will accept you. Before you do that, you must give me 1500 aurums. Our treasury is growing thin. Show your dedication in this way.{***}
Very well. I shall travel to the Shrine and pay my respects to the Grazir Gods and the Dreaded One.{***}
No thanks, then.{***}
Good. I shall await your return... or not, if the Grazir Priests find you unworthy.{***}

Greetings, stranger. Why have you come here, to the holiest of our shrines? Have you come with a demand, or perhaps an offer? Either way, you will not be allowed to leave until you state exactly what you want here.{***}
I have come to join your Order and religion. I believe in your beliefs, and I will do anything it takes to prove it. Shadesin sent me here. I have already paid him 1500 aurums in advance.{***}

You think it is that easy? You will have to prove yourself. I will bestow the rank of Grazir Pilgrin upon you for now. Talk to Shadesin again. You must prove yourself as worthy before you can become a full member, or learn any of our secrets. Leave me now.{***}
Thank you, my Lord. I will serve our Order well.{***}
Good day, would you like to have a look at my wares?{***}
Yes, let me see what you have for sale.{***}
No, thanks.{***}
Thank you for your business.{***}
Good day, {reg33?madame:sir}. It is an honor to meet the {reg33?lady:man} that rid us of the oppresive Atanos Octiem. You can buy all kinds of Venetoran troops from me.{***}
Excellent. Let's see what you have.{***}
I don't need any soldiers right now.{***}
Let me know what you're interested in.{***}
Companion Infantry.{***}
Companion Archers.{***}
Companion Cavalry.{***}
Legionaries.{***}
Kaleros.{***}
Sabovalars.{***}
Never mind.{***}
Hmm, let me see...{***}
I can get you those for a price of {reg1} aurums each. How many would you like?{***}
That is too expensive.{***}
Let me reconsider.{***}
They are all at your service, {playername}{***}
Glad to see you again, {playername}. Have you come for more Legion troops?{***}
Indeed.{***}
No thanks, I have to go.{***}
Good day, {reg33?madame:sir}. It is an honor to meet the {reg33?lady:man} that rid us of the oppresive Atanos Octiem. You can buy all kinds of Venetoran troops from me.{***}

I don't need any soldiers right now.{***}

Hmm, let me see...{***}
I can get you those for a price of {reg1} aurums each. How many would you like?{***}
That is too expensive.{***}
Let me reconsider.{***}
They are all at your service, {playername}{***}
Glad to see you again, {playername}. Have you come for more Legion troops?{***}
Indeed.{***}
No thanks, I have to go.{***}
...I...I can hardly believe it!{***}
VocêPodemos percorrer sozinhos o resto do caminho. Obrigado.
Well? Have you made a decision?{***}
...Hmm? Oh, it's you, that company leader whose been helping us in the field. What are you doing here?{***}
I'm curious as to what a man of your rank is doing here in the barracks.{***}
I'll just be going now, Visavo.{***}
And why should the business of a Visavo concern an outsider like yourself?{***}
A ranking officer just seems out of place here, is all.{***}
You're right.. I should move along.{***}
No offense friend, but there may be more forces at work within the Legion than an outsider could understand.{***}
Try me, Visavo. I may surprise you.{***}
These are sensitive matters. However, you have proven yourself a friend to the Legion...{***}
...Hmm? What are you looking at, soldier?{***}
Sir, I was just wondering why you're back here in the barracks.{***}
Forgive me, Visavo.{***}
And why should the business of a Visavo concern a legionary like yourself?{***}
A man of your rank just seems out of place here, that's all.{***}
You're right, sir. I should move along.{***}
Hmm...say, your accent sounds quite odd for a {reg33?woman:man} of the Third. Who is your Visavo?{***}
Uh...Visavo...Oct...uh...Oct-Octervius?{***}
Who? You don't even kn- hold on. Your uniform looks off as well. You're not a real Third soldier, are you!{***}
You know, I should probably get back to my post-{***}
Wait, soldier, your face looks awfully familiar...you're the renowned {reg33?lady:lord} {playername}, aren't you? You've caused quite a stir in the lands of Perisno lately.{***}
(Looks puzzled) Very well...soldier. [Not enough renown]{***}
{playername}, can I be honest with you about something?{***}
Yes, what is it?{***}
Sorry, but I really must be going now.{***}
I...I am not particularly fond of the way Atanos Octiem is running the Third. His vision of resurrecting the ancient Venetoran Empire is, well, nonsense.{***}
He fails to recognize the strength of the new powers of Perisno, and I worry he will bring about the destruction of the Venetoran legacy once and for all.{***}

I have a proposition for you. I have covertly secured the support of my division and second-in-command Kalero to revolt against the Atanos, and with your help we may actually stand a chance at beating him.{***}

I will warn you however. Even with my division gone, we would be assaulting over 400 troops holed up in this outpost, as well as the Atanos' personal guard regiment. It will no doubt be a punishing fight. What do you say?{***}
Very well. I will help your cause defeat Atanos Octiem and his Legion.{***}
I'm sorry, Visavo, but I do not believe I am currently prepared for such a challenge.{***}
A million thanks, {reg33?madame:sir}. You will not regret overthrowing the militant Octiem. My troops and I will meet you outside the fort.{***}
We've done it! Sacrifices were made on both sides, but with your help we've captured Octiem and rid the land of his corrupted Legion.{***}
Now that we have control of the fort, we can make some long overdue changes.{***}

The prosperous market that had been shut down by Octiem to discourage external interaction will be reopened at once. We will also no longer send scouting parties out to harrass Perisnoan inhabitants.{***}
As we are now forever in debt to you for preserving our culture, I offer to you Octiem's personal treasury. You can also feel free to use the market and hire troops from our military specialist.{***}
Thank you, and take care {playername}.{***}
Extraordinary. Thanks to you and your men, Venetor...is ours once again. I never thought I would live to see this day.{***}
It's good to see that you escaped as well. It seems like the Assassins managed to put together a far stronger army than we could have expected.{***}
Atanos Austad! We weren't expecting you to come here. What happened?{***}
Bom, estamos quase chegando à {s21}. Podemos percorrer sozinhos o resto do caminho. Aqui está seu pagamento... {reg14} denares. Obrigado por escoltar-nos. Boa sorte!
Have you investigated the stronghold?{***}
Welcome to the Third Legion outpost, {reg33?Lady:Lord} {playername}. What can I do for you?{***}
I have reconsidered your quest.{***}
What is the history behind this outpost?{***}
Just admiring the temple, sir.{***}
Welcome to the Third Legion outpost, {reg33?Lady:Lord} {playername}. What can I do for you?{***}
About your conflict, Atanos. What was it you were planning to do?{***}
What is the history behind this outpost?{***}
Just admiring the temple, sir.{***}
Welcome to the Third Legion outpost, {reg33?Lady:Lord} {playername}. What can I do for you?{***}
How is the Third Legion doing, Atanos?{***}
What is the history behind this outpost?{***}
Just admiring the temple, sir.{***}

This outpost used to be a strictly military establishment in the time of the Venetoran Empire. When Emperor Trilond died and the rebellions began, this was one of the few encampments that was not completely destroyed in the civil war.{***}

The first Atanos Octiem, leader of the original Third Legion, led his troops and a group of civilian supporters to this outpost, intent on preserving what culture and tradition they could of their once great nation.{***}

For hundreds of years the Legion sustained itself, defending against the many threats that appeared over the centuries. Our liberation from the new egomaniacal 'Octiem' I believe represents a turning point for the future of our people.{***}

The people are flourishing now that I have relaxed some of the restrictions of the pretender Octiem. I sense a renewed feeling of vitality and yearning for something...something greater than our current situation.{***}
Is there anything I can do to help?{***}
Most interesting. I wish you luck, then.{***}

Well...perhaps. I am at an impasse, {reg33?Lady:Lord} {playername}. One one hand, I refuse to follow in the footsteps of Octiem and squander the lives of my fellow Venetorans in some fruitless conquest. On the other hand, I feel my people have been confined to this life for too long, and that they wish to fight their way back to the frontlines of Perisno.{***}
I understand your concern for your people. Say I were to put my forces at your disposal, do you have a plan?{***}
I would like to be of assistance, but you will have to ask me at a later date.{***}
I'm sorry but I believe you should not push your luck any more than you already have.{***}
Of course, I understand. Please do not let me inconvenience you at this time.{***}

Ah, well...you have no doubt noticed the abandoned stronghold to the northwest of this outpost. This stronghold holds a special place in the hearts of my people, as it was the economic, cultural, and political capital of the Venetoran Empire- this was the site of Venetor itself.{***}

Though the city was destroyed in the civil war that first drove us away, it seems to have been partly rebuilt over the past decades. This leads me to believe it is not as abandoned as many people think.{***}
Do you have any ideas about who you think may be inhabiting your old homeland?{***}

I can't say for sure. We clashed long ago with the Grazir Worshippers in the storied Battle for the Enlightenment, and I assume that the secrecy of these inhabitants has no less than a sinister origin. However, there is only one way to find out, and this could be your task if you would be so noble as to take it.{***}
What have you decided, {reg33?Lady:Lord} {playername}?{***}
I will take your quest, Atanos, in the name of liberation for your people.{***}
I must take some time to think this over.{***}
Excellent! Thank you for taking on this task, and best of luck.{***}
Yes, I stormed the stronghold with my men and cleared it of the Assassins of Ral'Daiun that were camped inside.{***}
I am still working on it.{***}
So it was the Assassins of Ral'Daiun...how strange. I can't say there have ever been direct hostilities between us before, but I can't imagine this will please their leadership.{***}

You have given us the opportunity to reclaim our home, and for that I am grateful. I have already dispatched a group of pioneer citizens from the outpost with an elite guard regiment to assess the situation and set up initial defences around the stronghold.{***}

I fear that a retaliatory strike on the stronghold may be inevitable- the Assassins are not the type to let aggression go unpunished. I am reluctant to petition you for your aid again, but I don't believe the stronghold will stand against attack without your help.{***}
Yes, Atanos. My men will gladly join yours in the defence of Venetor.{***}
I'm sorry, but I can offer no more assistance at this point. Good luck to you.{***}
The Legion owes its survival to you, {reg33?Lady:Lord} {playername}. My best men will be waiting for you at the stronghold to discuss the defence.{***}
Well, {reg33?Lady:Lord} {playername}, I must admit it simply felt wrong for me to be holed up in that fort while you fought off our enemies with Visavo Hendrus and his men here.{***}
So, I decided to make haste towards the stronghold with ten of my personal guards - I was worried we would be too late, but it appears we made it just in time.{***}
Just as we were riding past Ingvar's Mercenary Guild, we caught a glimpse of what must have been the assaulting force marching along the coast of the lake in the distance.{***}
Though marching on foot, they must have been no more than two hours away by now. We should begin making battle preparations now. Visavo Hendrus, {reg33?Lady:Lord} {playername}- ready your men!{***}
I'm glad that you made it out alive as well. Unfortunately it seems that the fate of Venetor lies not where we hoped it would.{***}
So it seems. Though we may have failed on this day, the fight continues. Thank you for fighting for what is right, and good luck in your future adventures, {playername}.{***}

Now that the stronghold is fully under our control, we can begin to repair and repopulate the town. Fortunately it looks like it has been spared much damage, so we should be able to get up and running in short order.{***}
The final task we need to complete is, unfortunately, out of my hands once again. I'm afraid it would be far to dangerous for me to trek across Perisno at this time.{***}
I have a contact in Krain- a long time friend I would trust with my life. He is an expert trader, and will be able to set up some initial caravan lines from Venetor to jumpstart our eeconomy.{***}
He won't answer to anyone, however. You must be sure to ask him what the best way to get to the water mill is, and he will know you were sent by me.{***}
Victory is whitin our grasp, {reg33?Lady:Lord} {playername}. Good luck.{***}
Muito obrigada por me trazer de volta! Mal posso esperar para ver minha família. Adeus.
Feel free to make use of the accomodations of the stronghold while you and your men wait.{***}
Thank you, Visavo.{***}
It's good to see you here, {reg33?madam:sir}. We are making plans for the defence of this stronghold against the imminent threat of the Assassins of Ral'Daiun.{***}
What do you know about this assaulting force?{***}

It's difficult to make an accurate estimate because the Assassins are very good at counter-espionage. However, one of our scouts trailed a lead and suggests they have at least 300 men at their disposal.{***}
We're not certain when they plan to attack, so it would be best if you and your army camp here until the assault.{***}
How many troops do you have with you?{***}
I understand. See you on the battlefield, Visavo.{***}

I currently have an elite detachment of 10 Sabovalars, 30 Empyrean Legionaries, and 10 Companion Archers under my command. What we lack in numbers, we will make up for in discipline and training.{***}
Good. See you on the battlefield, Visavo.{***}
Maldito seja, mas você conseguiu, {playername}. Você acabou com todos os contrabandistas. Esta aldeia pode prosperar agora. Você certamente ganhou sua recompensa. Aqui, pegue, com meus cumprimentos.
What? What do you want? Leave me be. I have no time for beggars.{***}
Shut up, Eared!{***}
Hello.{***}
I am {playername}. Who are you?{***}
I have done it! Now, the Geldarin Naphali are free from oppression!{***}
I am a Geldarin Naphali.{***}
You have achieved it! I knew you would do it. My friend, we are forever in your debt.{***}
I have a gift for you. This is Duskfall, one of the finest bows ever forged by Geldarin Naphali. It is used now by others as well, but this is the original, best one.{***}
Thank you for your gift. I will help the Geldarin Naphali defeat the Elintoran Naphali. For glory!{***}
I haven't got the time.{***}
I long for the destruction of the vile scum of Elintoran Naphali. They have comitted atrocities against us that are unspeakable..{***}
I agree.{***}
The thought of Naphali disgusts me.{***}
I am a Geldarin Naphali. My ancestors were once the dominant Naphali clan, but that time is once gone. We are now pushed aside, ruled by our enemies the cruel, savage Elintoran Naphali.{***}
I will help you defeat the Elintoran Naphali.{***}
Too bad. I dislike Naphali regardless.{***}
I think you are a good man. You have potential. My task for you is to conquer the capital city of Forniron, the city we are standing in right here. I think you can do it.{***}
Hearing that pleases me. I hope you will succeed.{***}
I shall help you conquer Forniron. I have no love for the Elintoran Naphali.{***}
Geldarin Naphali? There are enough of those scum in the world already!{***}
Greetings.{***}
Greetings to you too.{***}
I failed. I'm sorry.{***}
Oh . . . Oh well. I suppose you did the best you could. Bad luck, friend. Farewell.{***}
I have done it! I defeated the Red Immortals and took the shield.{***}
I knew you could do it! In my vision, I saw that one day a {reg33?lady:man} would come and defeat them! Now, I have a revelation to make: I used to be a Red Immortal.{***}
What?? Then why would you want me to kill them? And are the visions that you talked about all fake?{***}
They betrayed me and cast me out. I have longed for this day. Yes, the vision is fake too. And I have a reward for you...{***}
This is my old set of armor. Farewell, adventurer. I sense a great future in you...{***}
I have seen it! A vision! A piece of craftsmanship beyond the capabilities of a mortal, wielded by the masters of intimidation... and they all thought it was a lie!{***}
My good man, what in the world are you rambling on about?{***}
I told them they would come! I told them! But no, there is no evidence, and no, the books don't mention them. Now, after long last, I have proof! Real and concrete proof!{***}
You told them that what would come? Please, my patience is thinning.{***}

The Immortals, sir, the infamous Red Immortals, the 'mythical' elites of the Old Hakkon army! After an account written by the Hakkon historian Mirkhond was discovered some years ago, the tale of these invincible soldiers has been used to inspire many a young lad into enlisting in the army.{***}
So you say you have seen these men. Where would I be able to find them?{***}

I have indeed seen them, but their location was not clear to me. Perhaps you should ask a more learned man of what they know of this 'mythical' tale. They may know where to send you next. If you defeat these Red Immortals, you will be able to take nigh invincible loot and their legendary shield, the Aegis!{***}
Where would I be able to find such a man?{***}
I'm sorry- I've had enough of this nonsense. Good day.{***}
The lands of Tolrania is renowned for their interest in the intellects. You will certainly find someone to ask at the center of learning in Perisno.{***}

Você me decepcionou, {playername}. Havia 3 grupos de contrabandistas que pedi para você caçar. 3. Não {reg17}. Suponho que devo ser grato pelos que não voltarem, seus corações negros de vingança pelos pobres aldeões que colocaram suas cabeças a venda. Mas alguns retornarão, e isso será algo sangrento. Aqui. Pegue sua recompensa e deixe que tudo isso acabe.
Olá, {playername}. Estamos em dívida com você por trazer de volta a esposa do moleiro. Você é realmente u{m/ma} amig{o/a} de nossa aldeia.
Hello, {playername}, have you dealt with the Grazir worshippers yet?{***}
Yes, they are dead.{***}
No, they are still at large.{***}
The Grazir worshippers are truly a menace- it seems they have managed to find some otherworldly allies, and speak of a 'Dreaded One' whom they worship.{***}
That is distressing. We can only hope they, are swiftly defeated.{***}
In any case, thank you. The city of Galwe is grateful for your deed.{***}
Hello, {playername}, what brings you to the library of Galwe?{***}
Hello, who might you be?{***}
I am {playername}.{***}
Well met, {playername}. What brings you to the Library of Galwe?{***}
Is there anything I can do to assist your research?{***}

Actually there is. Grazir Worshippers are a scourge on our great city, and they often attack students of this library. Specifically, some outside the city are a great nuisance- could you deal with them?{***}
Of course.{***}
No, I have other business to attend to.{***}
Do you have any idea what to do with this piece of junk?{***}
Piece of junk? Let me ... Piece of junk?! This is ... the Weeping Moon!{***}
Weeping Moon? What is that?{***}

Weeping Moon has only ever been heard of in the books of legends. This elegant piece of artwork dances in the night in the hands of its owner. It is because of this blade that many nobility cannot sleep at night, for they may have just drawn their last breath.{***}

Legend has it that this dagger picks its owners, always finding a way to return to the hand of the killer. I ask of you, please give this to the Library of Galwe. I will even reward you handsomely for your contribution.{***}
Yes, that sounds fine to me. You may have it.{***}
Thank you so much! Please, have this. We appreciate your contribution.{***}
No, I have gone through hell for this.{***}
Very well. I can at least tell you where to go to restore this dagger to its original glory. {***}
Speak with the weaponsmith in Dwallnor, he will know what to do with it.{***}
Just looking around, carry on with your studies, sir.{***}
Very well, fair travels to you {playername}.{***}
Very well, I look forward to your success.{***}
Do you recognize the supremacy of the Dreaded One of Grazir?{***}
Never!{***}
Hah! Another infidel to destroy.{***}
Of course, I worship him as well.{***}
Excellent. We will break the nations of Perisno soon, Comrade...{***}
Podemos percorrer o resto do caminho sozinhos. Obrigado.

Bem, estamos quase em {s21}. Podemos cobrir o resto do caminho sozinhos. Aqui está o seu pagamento... {reg14} denares. Obrigado por nos acompanhar. Ah, e percebemos que você teve que passar por muito nessa jornada, que deveria ser comemorada em versos! Aceite este livro - cuidadosamente inscrito, Para {playername} dos seus estudiosos favoritos! como uma recompensa extra. Agora, espero que o refeitório está aberto. Boa sorte.
Leave me be. I am studying.{***}
Alright. Goodbye.{***}
Are you a scholar?{***}
-The man sighs - Indeed I am. Who are you?{***}

I am {playername}, at your service. I have come here, to Galwe, the great center of learning and education, to seek some answers to my questions. I was hoping a very learned man like you could help me.{***}
Well, I suppose I cannot blame a young man for being curious. What it is, exactly, that you seek?{***}
I wish to know more about the Red Immortals.{***}
What?? The Red Immortals are nothing but a children's myth! Leave me be, now. Please.{***}
I'm sorry for bothering, then. Can you at least point me to someone who knows more about it?{***}
-The man shakes his head and rolls his eyes.- Fine. But you must first do something for me.{***}
Of course. What do you need?{***}

The infamous bandit, called Rdahcim, stole a family heirloom of mine. It is a relic, shaped like a cup, and he took it. - The man grinds his teeth in rage - I want you to track that bastard down, destroy his lair, and return to me the relic. Then I shall give you a clue on where the Red Immortals are.{***}
I will do it.{***}
Good luck. You can find Rdahcim near the forests around here.{***}
No thanks. It's a waste of my time (fail the quest).{***}
Welcome to the Library of Galwe, {playername}. What do you need?{***}

Bem, estamos quase em {s21}. Podemos cobrir o resto do caminho sozinhos. Aqui está o seu pagamento... {reg14} denares. Também tínhamos um presente para você, um símbolo de nossa gratidão, mas parace que você está com o inventário lotado. Deixa pra lá! Obrigado por nos acompanhar. Boa sorte.
I have some troops that you can hire. I currently have {reg10} Alchemists avaiable, and each will need 5000 aurums as an initial payment. How many would you like to hire?{***}
Excellent.{***}
Very well, They will join your party. I have {reg10} Alchemists remaining, and each will need 5000 aurums as an initial payment. How many would you like to hire?{***}
I would like to hire one Alchemist.{***}
I would like to hire five Alchemists.{***}
I have to go now.{***}
It's me, {playername}. The one you talked to before. I have your relic.{***}

Ah! Very good then, {playername}! Thank you so much for this! Now, I believe I promised you information for the relic. You will need to go and travel to Amarna to consult my colleague, who is an expert on these matters.{***}
Thank you. Goodbye.{***}
Who the hell are you? And what do you want?{***}
Me? I am the one who will kill you.{***}
If you wouldn't mind, I'm trying to concentrate.{***}
Sorry for bothering you.{***}
The scholar of Galwe told me to find you. I have a question to ask.{***}
My friend from Galwe, yes. What exactly is it you need?{***}

I am seeking information about the legend of the Red Immortals. More specifically, where they are rumored to be located. He said that you are the greatest expert on the subject in all of Perisno.{***}

Well, I'm afraid I can only relay you once more to another source. I have closely studied the texts of the scholar Mirkhond for many years, but I have done so from a purely factual and historical perspective. What you want is more obscure and absolute. The Mythseeker will know the answer to your question, I have no doubt in my mind.{***}
Another person to track down...where can I find this Mythseeker that you speak of?{***}
The last I checked, he was near Sasspegah castle. Perhaps you should search around there.{***}
I seek them ... the myths...{***}
... (you leave the man alone).{***}
The scholar of Amarna told me to find you. I have a question to ask.{***}
What is it? Leave me be! I seek the myths, the truth! Do not talk of foolish scholars to me!{***}
I am sorry. I have a question about the Red Immortals.{***}
The Red Immortals? What business have you with them?{***}
Dangerous business. I seek their legendary weapons and shield, and I will kill them.{***}
You want to find them? And kill them? You are nothing but a fool. You cannot defeat the Immortals.{***}
That is your opinion. Please tell me where they are.{***}
-the man smiles to himself-. I will tell you ... you are going to die anyway. Go to the village of Wahran. That is all I shall tell. Now leave me be.{***}
Surrender or die!{***}
We are the Red Immortals, from the old Hakkon Empire. I would think twice before attacking.{***}
No thanks. You will die, here. Now.{***}
Greetings {playername}.{***}
Greetings to you too, great bard.{***}
I did it, Taragith. I have the book and the lyre.{***}
Excellent! You have done a great job! Here, let me take those..{***}
Aren't you going to tell me where the sword is, now??{***}
Hah! Of course! I have it ... right here, with me!{***}
... ... WHAT?? You mean to tell me that I went on this wild goose chase to find those two relics JUST for some sort of test that you concocted?{***}

Indeed. These two relics are going to be useful for me in my research for the Kingslayer, but they do not provide the answers to where Kingslayer is simply because I have it right here. I did what I did as a test for you. I wanted to see what type of warrior this generation had. You have still done a great favor for me, {playername}. You brought me two important relics. As your payment, I shall give you Kingslayer.{***}
Someday, you will be the one people write stories about. I have great hopes for you.{***}
Thank you, Taragith. I will make good use of this legendary sword. Farewell..{***}
Bard, I failed. I'm sorry.{***}
Oh . . . Oh well. I suppose you did the best you could. Bad luck, friend. Farewell.{***}
Muito obrigada por me trazer de volta! Mal posso esperar para ver minha família. Adeus.

Good day, my {reg33?lady:lord}. I am Targith, Great Bard of Perisno. I am the one who wrote the poems, 'Lost One's Soul', 'The Heir of the Heiress', and many more. I am also responsible for chronicling the histories of many legendary weapons and mysterious occurances in Perisno. Furthermore, I have written historical work for the Scholar's Guild, and my work has been praised all over the world.{***}
Continue, please{***}
I have other things to do than to listen to a fool. Farewell.{***}

I'm afraid that if I go on, I will never stop talking. You look like a capable type. I have recently been delving deep into tomes and accounts of the sword, the Kingslayer. It is said that the great Emperor of the Old Perisnoan Empire, Thyceo, slew seven different kings with that one sword to gain dominance. I might have a faint idea of where it is, now that I know most of the details. Would you like to hear my idea?{***}
Yes. Please tell me.{***}
I have other things to do. I believe Kingslayer to be a myth. Farewell.{***}

To search for the sword, you will need to find two items: a lyre and a book. It is said that Emperor Thyceo's bard wrote the secret of where Kingslayer was hidden in the back of his lyre, named the Lyre of Yralis. If this proves untrue, then the book will hold the secret. The book, called the 'Biography of Emperor Thyceo', has the location of the sword inside. I am certain that the secret to Kingslayer lies inside one of these two items.{***}
Interesting. Where shall I find the lyre and book?{***}
I have better things to do than going on a futile treasure hunt. Farewell.{***}

Oh, it is easy. You must meet an old reclusive hermit, called the Unusual Hermit by everyone around him, at Verlorne Castle. He know where the Lyre is. And the Biography of Thyceo, hmm, I think that the Priest Calain can say something about it's whereabouts, but, alas, I don't know where he lives now. Be warned, these two items are going to be very hard to acquire. You will need to be prepared to face many hardships in order to obtain them. However, I believe you can do it. If you succeed, you get the greatest sword of all... the Kingslayer, rumored to have a blade that never dulls. Oh... and, if you do find these items, you will most likely need me to translate the words for you, as they are written in Old Perisnoan dialect.{***}
Alright. I shall go search for them.{***}
I am not interested, sorry. I don't need a new sword and there are no guarantees of success, after all.{***}
What do you want?{***}
Nothing. Goodbye.{***}
Are you the one they call the Unusual Hermit? Can you tell me where the Lyre of Yralis is?{***}
I am indeed the hermit. I was once a great general, serving under the Freelancer Guild. But that was a lifetime ago... who are you, and what do you want?{***}
(Lie) I am the descendant of the bard Yralis. I need to know where he hid it.{***}
My name is {playername}. The Great Bard Taragith sent me. We need the Lyre for one of Taragith's discoveries.{***}
I hope you are not trying to fool anyone ... do you think me an idiot? Yralis left no descendant. Begone!{***}
Taragith? Hmm..what has he gotten himself into this time, I wonder? I have heard that you might find the lyre somewhere near the Four Pillars. There, you will find a noble by the name of Galine.{***}
Where? [Intimidate]{***}
Where?{***}
Ah. I'd forgotten that it is not called by that name anymore... it is Westrey Castle.{***}
I don't fear you, {reg33?wench:knave}, I've killed men who were thousand times better warriors than you. But I like your methods. You can find him at Westrey Castle.{***}
Nothing. Sorry for bothering.{***}
Are you called Galine?{***}
Yes. My name is Galine Goldine, and you are... ?{***}
(Lie)I am the last descendant of Emperor Thyceo. I seek the lyre of my ancestor's faithful bard, Yralis.{***}
My name is {playername}. Great Bard Taragith sent me. He seeks the lyre of Yralis for a recent discovery he made.{***}
Do you think I am stupid? Thyceo left only one descendant, who died early in his reign. Take off.{***}

The Lyre of Yralis is an heirloom of my family. However, a Valahir raider by the name of Sekr Frosttongue took it from me. I do not know where it is now, but maybe the Priest Calain will know. Calain once preached to him, I have heard. He currently resides somewhere near Forde but I am not sure exactly his whereabouts. Search around that area.{***}
Well. I will travel to the countryside of Forde, then. Farewell.{***}
Nothing, I'm leaving.{***}
Priest Calain? That is you, correct?{***}

That is who I am. I used to be full of life ... full of zeal and religion. I am now a priest in all but name. I grow old, and my mind grows old along with me... (his eyes grow distant for a second, then turns back to you). Did Taragith send you? He seeks the Book, does he not?{***}
Yes, and I also want the knowledge of the whereabouts of the raider Sekr Frosttongue.{***}
I will tell you where he and the lyre are. But do me a favor first. You must kill me. I would like to quicken my journey to the afterlife. Please, do it.{***}
Well. I will do it, if you wish it so.{***}
I am not an assassin. I shall not do it.{***}

Good job. This is our first step towards the resurrection of the Illican Empire! Come back to me for harder challenges.{***}
Hello, {reg33?lassie:young man}! Are you looking for a  job or something?{***}

The Illicans have been in this land for a millenia, and we have lived in peace unless threatened. We have never intentionally provoked others and are a good people. The Drachens invaded however, and drove us out of our homes and burned our farms! They have commited atrocities. One certain caravan carries a lot of gold. It happens to be traveling to us right now. Can you raid it for me and bring the gold to me for proof?{***}
Yes. I will. For the glory of Illica!{***}
No, I don't have time for that!{***}
Excellent!{***}
Desculpe, mas não há lutas durante a noite, por favor, volte pela manhã.

No one you want to know about.{***}

I want to kill you for the glory of Illica!{***}
Never mind...{***}
Hey, I recognize you! You're the one who's been causing trouble around here lately. Have you come willingly to die?{***}
Yes, I have come to kill you, in the name of Illica.{***}
Fool! You do not know the power I possess. I have been chosen to destroy the Illican race.{***}

Of course! There is a local Reich lord in the area who has been hunting down Illicans without end. I want you to go and kill him. He is a cruel man with no loyalties except gold and greed. He will have some strong troops, so be careful.{***}

Not yet.{***}

Hello again, {playername}. My next task for you will be a hard one.{***}
Have you killed them all yet?{***}
Hello again, {playername}. Word of your deeds is spreading among our people.{***}

A harder task, eh? There isn't anything right now, but maybe you can pass the time by defeating a certain dragon priest for me. He is near Voldeburg. What say you?{***}
That's a good idea. I will do it.{***}

Not yet.{***}

There is a man by the name of Gunnarr. He has been dubbed the Illican killer, and is a Mercenary soldier from Nisaynia. He has special methods of defeating our men, and none of us have managed to fight him and win.{***}
So you want me defeat him?{***}
Indeed. He has ways to kill Illicans, but not normal men. Scouts report that he is currently near this town. I have every faith in you that you will succeed.{***}
I will do this.{***}

You have quite a bounty on your head from the Reich. I will enjoy crushing your skull. For Wodin and Vanir!{***}

Have you conquered the town yet?{***}

I cannot thank you enough for what you have done! From now on, you may recruit Illicans from me whenever you like.{***}

It has been many years since our conquerers have abused and banished us. We are now fighting back - because of you, our hero! It is now time for you to complete your ultimate task. I want you to conquer this city, Voldeburg.{***}
So the time has come?{***}
Indeed. You are our champion now. Fight well, and win!{***}
Thank you.{***}
I need to prepare first.{***}
Hello. Can you tell me more about the lore of Illica?{***}
Of course, my friend! What would you like to know about them?{***}
Tell me about the general history.{***}
We are a proud race, and have been living in Perisno for centuries. We come way before the Elintorans, or even the Third Legion, I daresay. Our culture is rich and deep.{***}

The Reichans came a few years ago, intent on destroying us. We were already weak from a recently civil war between us and an opposing clan. The Reich came, built huge sprawling cities in our land, and drove us out.{***}

However, you, our hero, came in time. You helped us drive the Reich out and reclaim some of our land. For that, we thank you eternally. You will be remembered in our stories alongside our other great heroes like Zeladeck, Myrians, and Ha'beo.{***}
Very interesting. Good bye.{***}
Never mind.{***}
I would like to recruit some Illicans.{***}
Farewell.{***}
Of course! They all cost 150.{***}
Actually, I don't need them at the moment{***}
I would like to hire one Illican Hunter.{***}
I would like to hire five Illican Hunters.{***}
I would like to hire ten Illican Hunters. {***}
I would like to hire twenty Illican Hunters. {***}
That is too expensive.{***}
Thank you. Goodbye for now.{***}
It is an honor being part of your company.{***}
I want to see your skills.{***}
Very well.{***}
Done.{***}
I think we need to part our ways.{***}
Thank you.{***}
Well done, good {reg33?madame:sir}.{***}
Welcome back to Arendal. How is your quest going?{***}
Hello there, you fine young fellow. Would you like me to tell you about the Dueler?{***}
Bom dia, {s0}. É sempre uma honra tê-l{o/a} aqui em {s10}.
The Dueler? Never heard of him. Go on, you have me intrigued.{***}
No thank you. I have something urgent to attend to.{***}
Well, to be honest, I know very little about the Dueler himself. What I do know more about is his...weapon.{***}
A weapon? What kind, a sword?{***}

A sword, yes. A very special kind of sword; a rapier. This rapier, though I have never seen it myself, is supposed to be one of the finest pieces of craftsmanship to ever exist in Perisno; its speed and the Dueler's own skill making him nigh invincible in combat.{***}
Interesting. Where can I find out more about the Dueler and this rapier of his?{***}
The dueler holds godlike status among the trainers of Perisno who can be found the many training ground locations. They will probably know more about him than I do. Good luck.{***}
Good news. I have the rapier.{***}
No way! Do you mind if I...hold it?{***}
Go ahead.{***}
I'd rather you not.{***}
Fantastic. It's so incredibly light, yet strong as well. It seems to be designed for thrusting attacks.{***}
Fair enough, it looks very valuable. A sword of that design seems very adept at thrusting attacks.{***}
You're a very lucky {reg33?woman:man} to have gotten your hands on such a weapon. Take good care of it for me, will you?{***}
Will do.{***}
I am here to fight your men.{***}
Actually, I have a question to ask you about...more mysterious matters.{***}
A question? Ask away.{***}
I was told that you trainers hold a certain man with the utmost respect for his proficiency in combat. I was wondering if you could tell me a little more about this man, the Dueler.{***}

The Dueler? My my, it has been many years since I last heard that name. To answer your question: yes, I can tell you a little more about him. However, as I don't want this rather valuable information to fall into the wrong hands, you must first prove your worth to me.{***}
And how might I do that?{***}
Excellent. Are you ready to begin?{***}

Well, in a normal practice fight, I would start off easy and work you up the tiers of difficulty. Instead of doing that, I will put you up against 3 of my finest fighters in a row, and then I will tell you what you want to hear. Are you ready?{***}
Yes I am.{***}
Here you go then. Good luck.{***}
Just a minute. I am not ready yet.{***}
Hey, You will never make it if you don't practice.{***}
Well done, very well done. Not only have you proven yourself but you have also impressed me greatly. I am confident that I can now tell you what I know.{***}

It was on that day, the first and last I saw of him, that this man approached my training field. He did not give a name, so thereafter we simply referred to him as 'the Dueler' for reasons that will soon become apparent.{***}

The moment he began to spar I knew there was something different about him. It was his flawless technique, his record-setting defeat of my fighters, maybe even the sun dancing off that fancy sword of his- it was incredible. I even threw uneven matchups against him, even outnumbered twelve to one he managed to dodge and slash and parry his way to victory.{***}
Soon my men had all but collapsed from exhaustion, and the Dueler, sheathing his narrow sword, turned and departed with nothing but a nod in my direction.{***}
My account of the Dueler is one of many among trainers in Perisno, and you can find a compendium of information on the man in the great library of Galwe. Farewell, and good luck in your quest.{***}
Oh, you again? What is it?{***}
I beg your pardon, but this book requires my full concentration.{***}
Vigie seus modos enquanto estiver dentro destas muralhas e não teremos nenhum problema.
I don't want to disrupt your work, but I was hoping to find someone who can direct me to a specific book.{***}
My apologies.{***}
Alright then, quickly. What are you looking for?{***}
I was told this library houses a compilation of information about a man named, or...nicknamed, the Dueler?{***}

Ah, yes! Funny you should inquire about the book at this time, as I was actually about to return it to the library. I had planned on reading it but was sidetracked by my newfound interest in Tolranian political history.{***}
Did you know that Nibor Hood, the nefarious leader of the Outlaws, is the brother of the Tolranian claimant, Lady Tylora? How fascinating!{***}
Anyway, where was I...oh yes. I suppose I can lend the book to you for a little while, until you find what you need. So long.{***}
I'm here to return the book you kindly lent me.{***}
Unfortunately, the book is no longer in my possession. How much do I owe you?{***}
Excellent! I was beginning to worry that you weren't going to bring it back.{***}
I made some notes here and there, and added some information I think you'll find to be...quite relevant the the story of the Dueler.{***}

You...you wrote in a library book!? How could you defile such a delicately assembled compilation of information! Besides, how useful could your little anecdote be? Gah! I don't have time for you right now.{***}
You lost the book!? Gah...the library will want at least 1000 aurums for losing such a valuable piece of information.{***}
Right, here you go.{***}
Fine. Now leave me to my studies, you irresponsible swine.{***}
I don't have that kind of money.{***}
Well, I would advise you get out of my sights before I call the city watch on you!{***}
Nós não devemos falar enquanto estamos de guarda, {s0}.
You've far exceeded my expectations {reg33?Lady:Lord} {playername}. I will be sure to spread the word of your great accomplishment on this day.{***}
He's a tough one isn't he? I hope you learned a lesson or two about humility, among other things.{***}

That was very impressive, young {reg33?lady:man}. Don't feel too good about yourself, however; the Dueler's talent cannot be compared to the men you just fought. Are you sure you still want to do this?{***}
Are you ready to take him on again?{***}
Hmm...as I suspected, it seems you need more practice after all. Come back when you and your men have trained harder.{***}
Are you ready?{***}
Hello again. So what did you want from the Dueler?{***}
Good day friend. How can I help you?{***}
Anything else?{***}
That's not...THE Dueler, is it? I've been looking all over for him.{***}
Are you currently running any tournaments?{***}
Oh I'm just looking around, thanks.{***}
Unfortunately, no. This space has been...reserved for the time being.{***}
Ah, so I see you've heard of him. Lucky for you, you've found the place that he and his apprentices train.{***}
He prefers Qaletaqa because few Perisno mainlanders dare to venture out into the Aroulian jungle, and therefore he can perfect his art in seclusion.{***}
So, what would you like from him? He doesn't normally interact with strangers, however I'm sure he'd be willing to listen to someone with your level of determination.{***}
I am here to challenge the Dueler to a duel.{***}
Who exactly is the Dueler?{***}
I'll be back in a little bit.{***}
You want to...duel him? I don't mean to be rude, but I think that may be a bad idea.{***}

Nobody knows for sure who he is or where he comes from, and he isn't exactly the garrulous type. The few times I have heard him speak, however, his accent sounded like nothing I had ever heard before.{***}
Other than that he is not from Perisno, your guess is as good as mine. I do know that he wields that rapier of his with incredible mastery, better than anyone I've ever seen.{***}
Take your time.{***}
I'll be just fine. I'm ready to fight.{***}
On second though, I need some time to prepare first.{***}
Well I won't put you up against the Dueler right away. First, you and your first seven men can go up against his eight apprentices so that I can get an idea of your skill.{***}
Are you ready?{***}
Let's go.{***}
Let me reorder my party first.{***}
I'm ready.{***}
Give me some time to recover from that last fight.{***}
[He doesn't seem to hear you]{***}
Farewell, {playername}. It is time for me to return to my land.{***}
So I have been defeated.{***}
It was only a matter of time before my craft with the sword was bested by a challenger.{***}
I suppose you have more right than I to train these men. Take care of them for me.{***}
I also feel obliged to give you something else, for I can no longer hold it in good conscience.{***}
This rapier is made of precious Czestadtian steel, forged by my country's greatest blacksmith and designed to be the lightest and fastest sword ever made.{***}
It was given to me for becoming the most skilled fighter in Czestadt, and I was sent by my king to explore and display my strength to the world.{***}
It is now my duty to give the rapier to you, {reg33?lady:lord} {playername}.{***}
You are a most gracious opponent. Thank you for this gift.{***}
I can't accept such a valuable treasure of your people.{***}
You are generous to decline, but I must insist. This sword no longer belongs to me.{***}
Farewell, {playername}. It is time for me to return to my land.{***}
I would be glad to take upon myself a special mission.{***}

A mission? {playername}, I am not in position to ask you to do anything. However, I have a gift for you that I planned to delever to you for quite some time. Please accept it as a sign of our friendship.{***}

Could you perhaps do me a small favor, {reg33?madame:sir}? The task is this: I had planned to give my ruler a wolf as a gift, but alas, war has called and I cannot deliver the beast. Can you convey the animal to him in my stead?{***}
Very well, I would not shy from taking this job.{***}
Here is the wolf, and here is the money for his keeping. Know this -- if you should lose the steed, or fail to deliver it in time, you'll have only yourself to blame for what follows.{***}
Refuse...{***}
I am honored to hear that you would wish to bestow such an important task upon me... But alas, I have no time to play nurse to a wolf.{***}
The decision is yours. I shall find myself another who can aid me in this.{***}
Well hello, wayfarer! Why such a hurry? What is it that troubles you?{***}
And who are you to ask that?{***}
Who am I? Why, I am a freedom fighter, at your service. -- And the keeper of this road, too.{***}
What is that supposed to mean?{***}
No need for rude words, wayfarer. Better show us what you have in the cart, now.{***}
In the cart be arms, and I assure you I can use them...{***}
Then we shall just have to see about that...{***}
I believe not my eyes! What a treasure you have here, my good {man/lady}. Perhaps we shall take it!{***}
{reg33?madame:sir}, I brought you a modest gift from Baron Gereon{***}
What a beautiful strange beast! But it is taking a great risk, travelling these roads with such a wolf. Here, take this for your troubles.{***}
I don't have any work for you.{***}
O que você descobriu?
Saudações, estranho.
É hora de sairmos. Deixaremos a cidade separadamente, mas logo que possível nos reuniremos.
Você está fazendo um ótimo trabalho. Fique aqui um pouco mais.
{s11}, enviarei o resto do meu relatório por escrito.
Que feudo você tem em mente?
Esqueça. Por enquanto não posso lhe oferecer nenhum feudo.
Let's leave whenever you are ready.{***}
Please do not waste any more of my time today, {reg33?madame:sir}. Perhaps we shall meet again in our travels.{***}
Infelizmente não posso incluir mais ninguém em meu grupo no momento.
Sinto muito. Não posso pagar isso no momento.
Nos encontramos de novo.
Então... O que esteve fazendo desde nosso último encontro?
Que tenha um bom dia.
Sim?
Minhas desculpas se fui impertinente antes. Conte-me sua história novamente.
Não importa.
Você poderia ser útil em minha companhia.
Farei você saber se me inteirar de algo.
Ótimo! Dê-me apenas alguns minutos para me preparar e estarei em condições de partir.
Minha oferta de participar do seu grupo ainda está de pé, se você me aceitar.

Alegro-me em vê-lo com vida, {s5}! {s6}, e não sabia se você tinha sido capturado, morto, ou se tinha escapado. Desde então, estive vagando pelos arredores, procurando você. Posso reunir meus pertences e reintegrar-me à sua companhia?
Vim para tirá-lo daqui.
Graças aos Céus que chegou! Mas eu não posso ir a lugar nenhum com esta corrente entre as pernas. Você precisa encontrar uma maneira de tomar as chaves do guarda.
Que bom ver você, {s21}! Para ser honesto, esperava muito encontrá-l{o/a} novamente.
{s5} Quer que me reintegre à sua companhia?
Que bom que está de volta, meu amigo!
Sinto muito, mas não posso aceitar outra pessoa no momento.
Bem... procure-me se mudar de ideia, certo?
My {reg33?sister:brother}, the air here is as I remember it.{***}
My {reg33?sister:brother}, it is so good to be done with this chapter.{***}
I agree, brother. We have avenged Torsson, and killed the bastard Svafar.{***}
You are wrong, {reg33?sister:brother}. It was not we, but you. You have avenged Torsson, and you are deserving of all the honor. I was not strong enough to face him myself, but you did.{***}
Do not be foolish. We sail to Hylr, where we will regain our honor once more, you and I both. Fortune smiles upon us today.{***}
Então... Quer que eu volte com você ou não?

Há um assunto que requer sua atenção. A disputa entre o {s11} e o {s12} chegou a um ponto que tornou-se inadequada. Se você intervir, correrá o risco de ofender um dos lordes. No entanto, se não fizer nada, correrá o risco de parecer fraco. Esses são os fardos da monarquia, {milorde/milady}.

{s1} atualmente carece de um senhor. É possível que você queira mantê-lo dessa forma, para que possíveis lordes desejem se oferecer a ele mais tarde, mas por enquanto ninguém está recolhendo suas rendas.

No momento não há questões significativas o suficiente para exigir sua atenção. Devo observar no entanto, majestade, que não sou especialista em estradas sinuosas da política e estou ansioso porque me permitiram retornar à vida privada. Se deseja emitir alguns comandos básicos, estou à sua disposição, mas aconselharia que elegesse um de seus companheiros de confiança em meu lugar. Enquanto isso, há algum assunto que queira tratar?

Se me permite oferecer-lhe um conselho, {milorde/milady}, parece que o seu direito de governar como monarca soberano e independente ainda não goza do suficiente reconhecimento entre seus distintos companheiros, e isso pode levar a grandes problemas no futuro. Seria desejável que encontre algum outro reino com o qual tenha compartilhado interesses comuns no passado e busque o seu reconhecimento, para estabelecer-se em pleno pé de igualdade com os outros reis de Calradia.
No momento não há questões significativas o suficiente para exigir sua atenção. Há algum assunto que queira tratar?
Há algum assunto que queira tratar?
Tem alguma ideia para fortalecer a unidade de nosso reino?
I have the materials for {s4}'s gift.{***}
Ah, deixe-me pegar esses. Esperamos que isso possa consertar a desavença entre vocês dois. Você pode querer falar com {reg4?ela:ele}, e ver se eu obtive algum sucesso.
Abandonemos nosso plano de {s10}.

Sim, tenho certeza. Essa ideia fica descartada.

Quero enviar um emissário.

Quero que deixe de me servir como ministro.

Venetoran Paganism is one of most ancient of all religions in the land. Before the Enlightenment, practiced heavily by citizens of the Venetoran Empire. The Pagan gods are fluid in role and have no hierarchy or leader, hence they are worshipped equally. A pagan believes that their gods have an influence on every aspect of everyday life, and therefore are keen to maintain good relations with the ancient spirits. One of main reasons Venetor split from the original Perilo and their Religion was they didn’t accept The One God.{***}

The religion of the original humans (Perilo)…. The Sole Creator of the world and all that is in it. The perilo humans (mainly the Kingdom of Perisno) worship this God. He is always watching those who live on the face of the world, and has many lesser spirits who help him keep watch of the humans.{***}

The Church of Faith is a very popular religion in modern Perisno. The story of the Lord of Faith's banishment of the Grazir at the Battle of Enlightenment, and his subsequent transcendence is a story known to every child in the land. Practice involves communal gatherings to celebrate and commemorate the life of the Lord of Faith, all organized by the powerful Church of Faith and its leader, Grand Paladin Siegfried. ^^We must ensure our kingdom is accepted by the Church of Faith first. ^They will not appreciate us being friendly with the Grazir Worshippers. ^Grand Paladin Siegfried must not dislike us. ^We cannot be dishonorable.{***}

The Hakkon Inquisition is a major sect of the Church of Faith. Like followers of the Church of Faith, they believe that the Lord of Faith purged the land of the Grazir 365 years ago, however the zealots of the High Inquisition enforce stricter manners of practice of the Church's religion. Such practices include rigorous religious education, aggresive missionary activity, and even violence against opposing religions. They are led by High Inquisitor Esarion, who claims to have a personal connection with the Lord of Faith. ^^We must ensure our kingdom is accepted by the Hakkon Inquisition first. ^High Inquisitor Esarion must not dislike us. ^We cannot be dishonorable.{***}

The Tiergotter are the group of gods commonly worshipped in the lands of the Reich des Drachen. They differ from most other gods in that they are believed to take animal form instead of human form, with their principal god incarnated as a dragon. Their belief system is focused around personal excellence and rejection of failure, a message conveyed by the leading High Dragon Priests and Priestesses. Though a newer religion to Perisno, the Illica Falki Raiders have been notable quick adopters of the Tiergotter. ^^We must ensure our kingdom is accepted by the Reichs first. ^High Priestess of the Dragon Amara must not dislike us. ^We must be honorable.{***}

Worship of the New Gods is becoming increasingly popular in Maccavian lands as people grow weary of the values of the Old Gods. Unlike the Old Gods, priests of the New Gods preach values such as chivalry, equality, benevolence, and the importance of family in everyday life. Prince Drachus Flywing can be credited with its meteoric rise in popularity, and he aims to rid Maccavia of the dangerous Agathor Krex with what he sees are barbaric, antequated values. The principal New God goes by the name of Mal'Kij, and is seen as a paragon of honor. ^^We must ensure our kingdom is accepted by the New Gods first. ^Drachus Flywing must not dislike us. ^We cannot be dishonorable.{***}

The Old Gods are the most common dieties worshipped in Maccavia. Agathor Krex and most of the Maccavian nobility subscribe to the values of the Old Gods, namely strength, ambition, cunning, and struggle. The rift between the Old Gods and the New came when the god of revenge, Mal'Kiarj is said to have cast out his brother Mal'Kij for sparing the life of an enemy. Old Gods worshippers stay true to the message of Mal'Kiarj, seeking to crush the New Gods supporters once and for all. ^^We must ensure our kingdom is accepted by the Old Gods first. ^Agathor Krex must acknowledge us. ^We must be honorable.{***}

The physical form of the Goddess was put on Perisno to oversee the humans. She had great powers given to her by the One God, and could manifest at will. The Goddess was commanded to not mate with anyone and would be punished for doing so. She was of extreme beauty and just seeing her in this form would cause any human to be subdued. But she disobeyed, and mated with a Perilo male. The One God was displeased with the Goddess and banished her from ever returning. This new offspring became known as the Naphali, and their blood flowed black. The One God made it so, that everyone would know these people came from the Goddess that disobeyed him. Since Goddess Zedecia created the Naphali, they worshipped her.{***}

Eventually she became known as the Fountain Goddess when she created the great fountain in western lands. From the stories written she lives within the fountain itself, though it is said she manifests into her physical form every 300 years to walk among her people, and choose one worthy to lead when she returns back to the fountain.  All Naphali newborn are ceremonially blessed at the Fountain Temple of Elintor, though only the purest are greatly blessed, often becoming nobles of Elintor. ^^We must ensure our kingdom is accepted by either Elintor or Geldar first. ^Depending on who you decide to be friendly with, their liege must acknowledge us. ^We must be honorable.{***}

The Draharan have always been a spiritual people, and even before their uniting under one banner, one could find shrines and pantheons to their gods throughout the eastern savannah. They believe less in physical divine intervention and more in a numinous connection with the gods that can be attained through meditation and prayer. There is no organized church for these beliefs, instead nomadic mystics wander the land to spread the practice of personal reverie. ^^We must ensure our kingdom is accepted by Drahara first. ^Sultan Yusuf al-Salah must acknowledge us. ^We must be honorable.{***}

As long as there have been pagans in Perisno, there have been Grazir Worshippers to counteract their influence. The Grazir Worshippers strive to follow the wishes of their deity, the True Grazir, and they believe great rewards and power will be had from their loyalty. They attract men who seek authority over all else, and who will give their lives if it means they will be compensated fairly in the afterlife. Their leader, the fearsome Dreaded One, is said to be in direct contact with the True Grazir and will stop at nothing to execute its demands. ^^We must ensure our kingdom is accepted by them first. ^They will not appreciate us being friendly with the Church of Faith. ^They do not care for honor.{***}
