Sim?
Precisamos de abrigo para esta noite. Você nos deixa passar?
Quero falar com o lorde do castelo.
Quero falar com alguém do castelo.
[Deixar]
Espere aqui. {s2} lhe atenderá.
Milorde não se encontra aqui agora.
Quem é?
Não importa.
Espere aí. Lhe farei chegar sua petição.
Estou esperando...
Tudo certo. {s2} falará com você agora.
{s2} disse que não lhe atenderá. Saia daqui.
Milorde {s2} terá o prazer em atendê-lo, {senhor/senhora}. Entre. Vou abrir os portões para você.
Milorde {s2} não se encontra no castelo agora. Mas creio que ele não poria objeções para que você se refugie aqui. Entre. Vou abrir os portões para você.
Entre. Vou abrir os portões para você.
Entre. Mas certifique-se de que seus homens sejam sensatos e se comportem dentro destes muros. Milorde {s2} não quer problemas aqui.
Milorde {s2} não lhe quer aqui. Vá embora.
You have come just in time. Let us join our forces now and teach our enemy a lesson.{***}
You are making a big mistake by fighting against us.{***}
Creio que ainda não nos apresentamos devidamente {meu amigo/minha amiga}. Você salvou minha vida lá fora e ainda não sei o seu nome...
Sua ajuda foi muito bem-vinda, {estranho/estranha}. Eu sou o {s1}. Poderia me dizer seu nome?
Obrigado pela ajuda, forasteiro. Ainda não nos apresentamos apropriadamente, certo? Como se chama?
Meu nome é {playername}.
É um prazer, {playername}. Sou o {s1} e sou eternamente grato. Se alguma vez houver algo em que eu possa ajudá-lo, faça-me saber...
Muito prazer, {playername}. Estou em dívida com você pelo que acabou de fazer. Espero poder encontrar uma forma de retribuir o favor algum dia.
Muito prazer, {playername}. Sou o {s1}. Obrigado por sua ajuda, espero que nos encontremos de novo.
Again you save our necks, {playername}! Truly, you are the best of friends. {s43}{***}
You arrived just in the nick of time! {playername}. You have my deepest thanks! {s43}{***}
You turned up just in time, {playername}. I will not forget your help. {s43}{***}
Good to see you here, {playername}. {s43}{***}
Thank you for your help {reg33?madam:sir}. You saved {reg1?our lives:my life} out there.{***}
Thank you for your help {reg33?madam:sir}. Things didn't look very well for us but then you came up and everything changed.{***}
Thank you for your help, {reg33?madam:sir}. It was fortunate to have you nearby.{***}
Oh, {senhor/senhora}, sou tão grata por ter me resgatado. Irá me levar agora para minha família?
Estou em dívida com você por ter me libertado, {amigo/amiga}.
You're not going anywhere. You'll be my prisoner now!{***}
Alas. Will my luck never change?{***}
Você é livre para ir, {s65}.
Obrigado, {bom senhor/boa senhora}. Nunca esqueço a quem me fez um favor.
Who are you, if I may ask?{***}
Good sir, I am a Tolranian veteran. I am a direct descendant of Otto Waveshore, the man who led the first Tolranians onto Perisno. Do you know our history?{***}
No. I would like to know more.{***}

Of course. We, the Tolranians, were once a part of the Old Hakkon Empire from an island far from here. The Hakkon ruler was a tyrant, and a small group of men escaped using boats. It was a miracle they survived, and part of the reason was because of my ancestor, Otto Waveshore, who was a great captain.{***}
Very interesting. I guess I will leave now.{***}
Yes, I am familiar with it. It was a nice talk.{***}
Hello again. What is it this time?{***}
Hello again. What is it this time?{***}
I would like to know about your past, if you are willing to share.{***}
I am a direct descendant of Otto Waveshore, the captain who led a small group of rebels from the Hakkon Island to Perisno, where we could live a new life.{***}
Never mind.{***}
Who are you?{***}
Why, I am the royal scribe of Tolrania, of course. I chronicle the events and history of our great nation.{***}
That's nice. Goodbye.{***}
Could you tell me more about the history of Tolrania?{***}
Of course! What would you like to know about?{***}
King Torlian.{***}

King Torlian was the son of King Calarin, who was considered to be one our wisest and most benevolent monarchs of all time. When Calarin died at the age of seventy eight, he ascended upon the throne. He is not a bad ruler, but is always under pressure of his nobles telling him to live up to his father's name. {***}

Personally I think he has, in more ways than one. Take the Battle of Haelinfields, for example. King Torlian led the army himself against a superior Elintoran army. Torlian knew that they had many archers, so he lined all his Kingsmen with shields up and ordered them to lock shields the Volheere way. They advanced, under a hail of arrows. It is said that King Torlian himself was at the front.{***}

While the foolish Naphali wasted their arrows on our shields, the Horse Archers stealthily encircled the enemy army and soon the Naphali were the ones being shot. Then, Torlian ordered his mounted Kingsmen to advance and after a few hours of scattered fighting, the Naphali were beaten. We slaughtered over six thousand Naphali that day, and lost only five hundred of our own. T'was a great victory!{***}
That was an interesting talk. Goodbye.{***}
Never mind.{***}
You are not a lord of Tolrania. Don't think that I will tell any of our secrets!{***}
Hello again. What do you need from this humble scribe?{***}
I would like to know of some history of Tolrania.{***}
Nothing. Sorry for disturbing you.{***}
Hello, {reg33?madam:sir}. How can I help you?{***}
Can you tell me more about the Royal Smithy?{***}
I'm just looking around, thanks.{***}
The Royal Society of Metallurgy was ordained by King Calarin in the year 325, and the founding members of the Smithy were products of the advanced smithing guilds of the Old Hakkon Empire.{***}
Since its institution, the Royal Smithy has outfitted and equipped the most renowned nobles and lords in the realm, including our valorous King.{***}
I see, thank you.{***}
Who are you?{***}

I am Lord Halgar Malin, a minor noble of Tolrania. I participated in the War of the Woods in the year 320. We fought against the Elintoran rats and routed them in a great battle. King Torlian himself led our army. I still bear the scars from that battle, and proudly too.{***}

The Elintoran fools were so busy concentrating on our kingsmen that they did not notice as our horse archers surrounded and completely devastated their army. Of course, once the Kingsmen got into the melee, it was all over.{***}
Very interesting! Goodbye.{***}
Who are you again?{***}
Hello there, traveller.{***}
Hello.{***}
Have you found the republic in your journey so far?{***}
A what?{***}
A republic. A system of government where the ruler is...ahh, never mind. Here I go again.{***}
Tell me more.{***}

I was hoping you'd tell me! I'm a foreigner to these lands, a historian from the Klymorian Konqunites. One day I came across the news that some people had broken away from the empire and formed a 'republic' in this land. I consulted the scripts about this 'republic' and concluded that it was a fairer system of government for the people. I left my old life behind in search of this republic, but haven't found it so far. Have you seen it?{***}
I'll let you know if I hear anything.{***}
Goodbye crazy man.{***}
Uhh, I have to be somewhere else.{***}
Hello. Have you found the republic yet? I am from the Klymorian Empire, with a very oppresive government. I came here to search for the ideas of a republic after reading some scripts.{***}
No... I need to be going. Goodbye.{***}
What's new?{***}

Oh, you are that person! Remus wanted me to tell you that during a recent tournament he heard rumors that a large group of Sut Giants grew interested in the path of the Wolf, and they seek to join those Wolf Knights. Remus left for the town of Sut and he's looking for help.{***}
I don't want no business with the Wolf Knights!{***}
Alright, I'll find him then.{***}
Hello, {playername}! It's good to see you.{***}
I failed the quest.{***}
Hello, {playername}! It's good to see you.{***}
Group Sut Giant Interested in the Path of the Wolf is destroyed.{***}
Good work.  That's your reward. But be careful. People over there are watching you.  And I don't think their intentions are good.{***}

Hello, {playername}! It's good to see you. I've learned that many Giants here became interested in the path of the Wolf. One quite agressive group already went on their way to find the Wolf Knights. You need to stop them while I'm trying to calm down the Giants that still stay in the town.{***}
I don't want to mess with Wolf Knights or their followers.{***}
Sure, I'll deal with them.{***}
Greetings, traveler. Care for a drink?{***}
Sure. Thank you.{***}

There you go. Don't worry about paying me or anything - it's on me. The innkeep here doesn't charge me anything after I helped them out with a gambling debt. Then again, they don't charge for things within reason of course... but still. They're generous souls. A far cry from the people I used to associate with.{***}
What sort of people?{***}
The Wolf Knights. My story with them is a long one, but I'm willing to share if you're willing to listen.{***}
Absolutely. Please tell me.{***}
Where to begin... {***}

I am the younger of two brothers. We lived in a small village nestled amongst the foothills of the Reich's mountains. It was a fairly isolated place that saw the older men mindlessly driving away at their chores while the younger men nurtured dreams of the world that lay beyond the village. Lupus, my older brother, was in charge of guarding the village animals from the wolves that lived not far away. Every night he would stand vigil over our meager livestock, with the howling of the wolves to help keep him awake.{***}

Strangely, the wolves never attacked. They would prowl in the darkness, barely visible by the light of Lupus' torch, but they never approached. My brother complained to our village elder, Garrell, that his position was useless. Elder Garrell wouldn't have any of that. 'Nonsense!' he would say, and Lupus would spend the next few nights without provisions.{***}

Eventually, my brother came to me one day all worked up over something. He kept flexing his fingers, eyes wide and shoulders shaking. From fear, anxiety, or exhilaration, I couldn't tell. One of the wolves approached him the other night, he told me. Spoke to him in the human tongue. Asked him to follow it.{***}
Sounds like he had just fallen asleep or something.{***}

That's what I thought too. Yet he vehemently denied that suggestion, insisting that the wolf had spoken to him. 'Okay then,' I said. I asked him what the wolf had shown him. He wouldn't tell me. He just shook his head and ran off to the village well for water. Then the next day came. Lupus and another lad got into a heated argument that drew the whole village around. The argument threatened to get violent when Lupus's hands blurred faster than our eyes could follow... and smashed the man's head into bloody pieces.{***}
That couldn't be good...{***}

It certainly wasn't. We stood there in stunned silence, too afraid to say or do anything, while Lupus stared at his bloody hands. Elder Garrell was the first to gather his senses about him. He proclaimed Lupus exiled from the village the moment he did.{***}
Why not just hang him?{***}

I imagine it had something to do with my brother's apparent super strength - getting him in the gallows would've been a hard task, looking back on things. Despite what he did, I couldn't stand the thought of my brother travelling alone. I asked Elder Garrell if I could leave with Lupus. He nodded, but I think his mind was still trying to process what had happened. We left the village at dawn, with no farewells from the people we grew up with. As we trudged away, Lupus stopped me and laid his hand upon my forehead. 'Blessings upon you, brother,' he said. And what happened next...was... I don't know how to describe it.{***}

Imagine the thrill of adrenaline, the bloodlust of battle. Now take that energy, and multiply it a hundred fold. That energy coursed through my    veins, leaving me paralyzed... But when I regained my senses, I felt reborn. I felt strong. Powerful. Able to take on the world, a million to one. It was strange. After his blessing, I could lift boulders with one hand, and run faster than deer... We began our lives anew. At first we traveled from city to city, fighting in the arenas. Our strength was unmatched - Lupus could shatter shields with a flick of his wrist. I would dart around my opponents and knock them to the ground before they knew what was happening.{***}
Surely you are joking.{***}
This is enough. At first I believed your tale, but now I think it is pure fantasy. Good day.{***}

I do not jest. I could knock you to the ground and be out of the city before you could get back on your feet. But moving on... We won fight after fight, tournament after tournament. Prize money came to us, and we eventually bought our own armor, weapons, horses even. Notoriety came too, and soon we had a small following. Lupus had an idea. Why not go bigger, beyond the arena? Become mercenaries, he said, and see more of what the world has to offer. We recruited from our following of admiring fighters. And so the Wolf Knights were born.{***}
I am afraid I have not the time for any more today. Perhaps another time.{***}
Yes, I understand. Farewell, traveler. I shall finish my tale the next time we meet, if you will.{***}
Impossible. I'm not going to listen to your story any longer, fool man. Goodbye and good day.{***}
Forgive me, but I don't have the time.{***}
No thanks. I've got things to attend to.{***}
Hello, traveler. We meet again.{***}
Can you finish your story?{***}
Can you repeat the first part of your story?{***}
Goodbye. Maybe next time we shall meet again.{***}

Roaming through the misty forests of the Elintoran Nation, traversing the dry deserts of Drahara, meeting Lords and Ladies for employment. It was amazing. And exhilirating. We won battle after battle, always fulfilling whatever tasks the lords of Perisno set upon us. More soldiers, experienced veterans, joined us. The feeling of fabulous wealth and glory... Ah, there are no words to describe it. Lupus even found an old abandoned fort. We used it as a base of operations, and with our newfound wealth we had turned it into a fortress to rival that of any lord's...{***}
It all sounds too good...{***}

Of course it was. Life does not ride upon a single wave of euphoria. My brother was changing. I didn't notice it, nor did my other brothers, as we ourselves were changing as well. We were getting more ruthless. Brutal. Merciless. Bloodlust became our one true companion in battle, blind rage consuming us as we tore down our enemies. Lupus was getting more ideas. 'These so called lords are weak,' he told us one night. 'They are foolish, ever quarrelsome, unfit to hold their titles! They cater to the feeble, leech off the strong!''My brothers, Perisno is ripe for the taking!' he yelled.{***}

'Let me cast down the pretenders that lounge in their thrones,' said he. 'And let us show them the true meaning of power!' We all cheered him on, our adrenaline going into overdrive. The idea that we could hold our own kingdom, or even conquer all of Perisno? Anything seemed possible to us.{***}
So, what happened.{***}

Well, nothing happened to the Wolf Knights per se. It's what happened to me.One night came when we raided a Tolranian caravan in the woods outside of Vinica. They never knew we were coming. We charged out of the darkness, our lances lowered, swords swinging, their blood splashing... There was a caravan guard. Couldn't have been any older than me or Lupus when we left our home. I killed his horse while he attempted to flee, sending him to the ground, leaving him trapped under the weight of his dead companion. 'Mercy,' he begged, with my sword at his throat. He was a grown man, fresh into adulthood... and bawling his eyes out like a small child, sobbing into the night.{***}

I did nothing. In the midst of the clashing swords and dying screams, his face stood out above all else. I didn't know what was happening. The bloodlust was fading, and I was staring at the red and pink gore splashed across my greaves...Lupus came in bloodied armor on his black mare, saw what was happening, and plunged his sword into the guard's chest. He twisted the blade, and drew out the man's screams before he choked on his own blood. And my brother simply glared at me, and rode off. Later that night, he drew me away from the camp. I thought he wanted to reprimand me, scold me for my hesitation. 'I can't do this anymore,' I heard myself saying.{***}

The most peculiar sensation overcame me, and suddenly I was on the ground, staring at a sword embedded in my gut. My own brother had stabbed me. 'You are weak,' I heard Lupus say. 'The pack cannot function with a lone wolf in its midst. Face death bravely, Remus.' And he left. The last I ever saw of him... his silhouette blocking out the stars above. The night was getting darker, the stars dimmer. I passed out from the wound, and might have died were it not for a passing Naphali lord. I owe Artanher Methenor my life. Had his party not come investigating what had happened, I would surely have died, isolated and alone. He recognized my face from seeing it in the arenas, and took me into his castle to heal me.{***}
So, what did you do then?{***}

It took months, but I was able to recover thanks to him. I inquired about the raiding party my brother and I had led, without inferring I helped organize it, and discovered that they had left before Methenor came. I felt different once I had become healed, more determined and less wild. I turned down Methenor's suggestion that I swear homage to Queen Arwen, thanked him by swearing a life debt to him, and left for the Reich. I eventually found the old village I grew up in... in burned ruins. Everyone dead and gone. Bandits, apparently. Perhaps it was Lupus. {***}

I tried finding the fortress we had set up for the Wolf Knights. I couldn't find it, because I couldn't remember where it was... It's strange. You'd think I would remember where it would be...Anyways, I now spend my days travelling the land, looking for hints of Lupus' whereabouts. Perisno needs to know the threat he poses. His world is one where only the strong will thrive, while the rest shall be cast down.{***}
That was quite the tale... thank you for sharing it.{***}
No, thank you for listening. I've never told my tale in its entirety before. Beware the wolves, friend. And remember... the wolf can survive without the pack.{***}
I shall indeed beware them ...{***}

Wait! I almost forgot! Could you visit Artanher Methenor sometime, and tell him: 'I, Remus, still search for it. I am sorry.'? Please accept this as a token of my gratitude for listening as well. Anyone who is forced to endure my dreary tale should at least get some type of reward.{***}
Goodbye. I hope I will see you again sometime.{***}
Of course. Thank you again for that story.{***}
Remus told me to say that he is sorry and he still searches for it.{***}
What? How do you know Remus? That lad is still alive?{***}
Yes. I met him in a tavern and he told me to convene the message to you. He told me his entire story. It was saddening.{***}
Indeed. That lad has had a miserable past. I hope he is well ... (the lord's eyes grow distant). Thank you for giving me this. Take this as a token of my gratitude. Farewell.{***}
Those bastards, HIC... They knew all about it HIC... Cowards, HIC.{***}
Listen my good man, I think you've had enough to drink today.{***}
Just go away like everyone else HIC... Just leave me alone... HIC{***}
Alright... Alright... Just give me that *you take his drink*. Now, let's talk. What's the story behind this drink?{***}
(You spend some time with the man as he sobs quietly into his hands. He eventually becomes -somewhat- sober.){***}

You are still here? Well... alright. If it returns me to my drinking sooner, why not. Years ago, there was a great realm going from the mountains to the south, all the way to the Elintoran forest in the east. The name of this place was the Kingdom of Randor. The Kingdom's might was feared by everyone in Perisno. Even the Naphali showed us respect. But none of that mattered. When Randor was at it's strongest, the invaders came. They claimed to have fled from a far distant land. A land where disease, war and famine did rot the very essence of the land, the people.{***}

They claimed they weren't like them, and only desired peace... but behind our backs, they plotted with the other kingdoms. Together, they formed an alliance against us. The King of Randor couldn't believe it. They had deceived him, they had taken his hospitality and tossed it to the ground like garbage. The alliance took the King by surprise and..{***}
Wait wait wait. What does this have to do with your drinking problem?{***}

If someone didn't interrupt me, I would have gotten to that point sooner... So as I was saying, the alliance took the King by surprise. Before he could even send out his orders, the alliance attacked. In no time at all, they had taken half of his country. Together, they formed a coalition army and marched on the capital of the Kindgom of Randor. The Great city of Beler, the last stronghold of Randor. The siege went on for months. By the time the coalition army entered the city, many of it's inhabitants had already died from hunger, or by their own hands fearing the horrors of being conquered.{***}

The King and his family were left alone in the citadel protected by the last of the Royal guard. That is when the worst tragedy struck, one of the most cruel and vicious acts of the war. Lundrill, captain of the Royal guard, betrayed the King. He butchered the King's family, and gave their heads along with the captured King to the leaders of the coalition army. All of this, in exchange for the title and rights of the Lord of Beren.{***}

What he didn't know was that the coalition leaders were already planning on betraying him. They did just that when they razed the city to the ground, and burned the citadel with the remnants of the Royal guard alive inside, killing off the last of the Randorians...{***}
Are you sure you are sober? I've never heard of Randor or anyone you've mentioned... anyway, continue on. What does all of this have to do with you? {***}

Don't you get it, they wiped out an entire civilization! They are dangerous, they are liars, they are thieves! They betrayed me and left me to wander the world as punishment for thinking I could rule something they wanted to rule themselves.{***}
Look sir, I'll ask you agai... OH wait, so you were the King of Randor?{***}
The man looks sadly at the player, nodding his head up and down. Yes, I was... But that's a mistake I'll never make again.{***}
Okay... I'll leave you to your drinking then.{***}
Sounds like a load of grown up Falki dung.{***}
Why you... you... you little runt! I am the King! I'll crush you!{***}
(After your previous talk with the man, he does not want to look at you any longer. He stares sadly at his drink, thinking of the days of old, when he was the ruler of Randor.){***}

I told you!! DOOOOM! RUN!! THE ZANN ARE HERE! IN PERISNO!! They will conquer all, their armies will shake the earch and their Imperial Warriors, with armor as black as midnight, will conquer the world. DOOOM!{***}
How... how could it be! The Zann have been defeated. Doomsday is over. We have survived!{***}
DOOOM! We are ALL RUINED!!!!{***}
Do you feel alright good man?{***}
They are coming... He is coming... They, he will rule over all of us. He, they will make us all slaves, light will be no more. They are coming... He is coming...{***}
Who's they? Who's he? What are rambling on about?{***}

They live over the infinite waves, across a continent so far and vast. They will come, he will lead them. Revenge, power, a new empire will they come for. Over our dead bodies, our skulls, our children will they rule. For he, they are coming... Run we must, for all hope his lost. The final hour is upon us, we must ready for when they, he arrives. Flee we must... Flee...{***}
Who's coming, and how can we defend ourselves? Explain yourself. What do you mean by final hour?{***}

Deadly they are, a massive army he will bring. Thousands will die, we must run for all hope is lost. DOOMSDAY IS UPON US. The GODS have forsaken us... RUN, HIDE, FLEE those are our only chances. The others are already coming, they will follow them here. They will never stop, he won't let them. They will chase the others until they slaughter all of them, and then they will come for us.{***}
This is your last chance mad-man. WHO ARE THEY? What do you mean by doomsday?{***}

The ZANN are coming. The invincible army is crossing the Ocean, they are headed to Perisno. Unstoppable they are, thousands they will bring, thousands more await to cross aswell. We are doomed, we are dead, we stand no chance...{***}
(You leave the Mad-man talking to himself. Invincible army, phuahaha what a looney! Crossing the Ocean with an army. He must be really mad.){***}
DOOM! DOOMSDAY is COMING!! THE ZANN, they are COMING!! RUN, the gods have FORSAKEN US!{***}
What is the story behind your household troops, the Draharan Ghareebians.{***}

You wish to ask about my pride, my Draharan Ghareebians? Very well. The Draharan Ghareebians are a mix between Western, or 'Ghareebian' culture. They are like the dragoners of the Reich, except they are more nimble and trained by Draharans!{***}
Very interesting.{***}
Anything else?{***}
Why, I am the royal scribe of the Naphali, of course. I chronicle the events and history of our great nation.{***}
Could you tell me more about the history of the Elintoran Nation?{***}
Of course! What would you like to know about?{***}
Queen Arwen.{***}

Ah. You wish to know about the queen. Well, what can I say? She is a great ruler, although many find her rash and too hotheaded. She was always like that, even as a child. She has led our nation well, but many feel that she should not rule because of her age. She is very young and her critics say that she is inexperienced.{***}

Personally, I like the way she rules and I think that there is a bright future for the Naphali under her leadership. She has proved herself to be very worthy so far. Take her campaign against the Grazir Worshippers, for example.{***}

When Arwen took the throne, the Grazir Worshippers infested our land like vermin. She led her army personally against the Grazir Worhsippers and, one by one destroyed every Grazir Worshipper lair she could find. She also greatly strengthened the patrols around the kingdom, and we have not had an issue with the Grazir Worshippers since then.{***}
That was an interesting talk. Goodbye.{***}
Never mind.{***}
You are not a lord of the Elintoran Nation. Don't think that I will tell any of our secrets!{***}
I would like to know some history of the Elintoran Nation.{***}
I am a Dragon Anrufer, or caller. I serve only the Dragon Gods and it was my responsibility to 'call' dragons to us.{***}
What do you mean, 'was'?{***}

There are no dragons in this land, unlike where we come from. When we landed on this continent, we thought it would provide more breeding spots and possibly dragon brethren. However, I have called for a long time and there are no Perisno dragons that have responded. I will continue trying, though, and so will all who share my title.{***}
Very interesting. I must leave now.{***}
Who are you again?{***}
Greetings, {reg33?Madam:Sir} {playername}, and welcome to the sacred home of the Fountain Goddess.{***}
Welcome back to the Fountain, {reg33?madam:sir} {playername}.{***}
How else can I be of service?{***}
Who are you?{***}
What is this place?{***}
Would you be able to tell me about my blessing?{***}
Of course, {reg33?daughter:son} of the Fountain. Give me a moment.{***}
(She closes her eyes and steadies her breathing. Though she does not touch you, you feel a warm glow in your chest as she searches your being.){***}
That is all, farewell.{***}
My name is Thessalia, and I am the head priestess in charge of carrying out the will of the Fountain Goddess and protecting her Fountain.{***}
I was fortunate enough to be blessed by the Goddess at birth with clairvoyance, and I have dedicated my life to using this gift to perform the fountain ritual with all the Naphali newborn.{***}

This is the most hallowed site for all of Naphali, the great Fountain of the Fountain Goddess. Elintoran and Geldarin Naphali alike put aside their differences out of respect to the Goddess and the ancient tradition hosted in this grotto.{***}

Every newborn Naphali is brought to this site to recieve the Goddess' blessing, which determines among other things the noble status of the child, their gifts of sight, and their power of intellect.{***}
So? How did the Goddess deem me worthy?{***}

I am sorry to say, {playername}, but your blessing was not a favorable one. Though this does not reflect well on you in Naphali society, it does not mean you cannot go on to achieve great things.{***}
Your blessing was fairly common, {playername}. The Goddess chose neither to favor or hinder you in this life- take from that what you will.{***}

Most impressive, {reg33?Lady:Lord} {playername}. You appear to have been granted quite a favorable blessing at birth, and you will find that the common Naphali may come to respect you more for it. It is your duty now to make use of this blessing and achieve great things.{***}

Extraordinary, {reg33?Lady:Lord} {playername}. I have seen few individuals as highly blessed as you appear to have been- this is truly a special moment. You are a paragon of Naphali values, and possess the dignity and gravitas of a great leader. I can only imagine the great achievements yet to come in your future.{***}
Fair enough. I will not let Goddess' blessing hinder my pursuits in this world. Thank you for your help.{***}
Very good, my priestess. I will be sure to uphold the integrity of this tradition and prove my worth to Naphali kind.{***}
Good to see you, {playername}. What can I do for you?{***}
(The man seems to be in a trance, looking through you as though you are not there){***}
(The man snaps out of his trance, and looks at you)Hello again.{***}
Are you alright, good man? You seem to be in some sort of daze.{***}
(He blinks a few times, and looks at you inquisitively)Wha-huh? What do you want?{***}
I just wanted to make sure you were feeling well.{***}
Yes, yes...I am just fine. I was almost there, I know I can feel it nearby...{***}
Feel what nearby? What are you doing all by yourself back here?{***}
The sword, of course, the sword. The Lord of Faith has not left this place- I can feel His spirit and I am closer than ever to finding it.{***}
Sword? The Lord of Faith had a sword?{***}
What did the Lord of Faith have to do with this place?{***}
No, it was not His sword per se. It was, however, blessed by the Lord in humanity's twilight hour.{***}
The Lord of Faith has everything to do with this place. Years ago, He was responsible for saving humanity here in its darkest hour.{***}
The sword I seek was wielded by Atanos Giulien, the leader of the fledgeling Third Legion against the crusade of the Grazir Worshippers.{***}
In the Battle for the Enlightenment, he defended this very fort with the Lord of Faith against the strongest force of Grazir Worshippers this world had ever seen.{***}

Giulien fought back to back with the Lord, and struck down the Grazir leader with his sacred blade. Since the Enlightenment, the sword has been lost to the Legion- I have taken it upon myself to find it again.{***}
I will keep an eye out as well, and let you know of my findings.{***}
Most interesting. I wish you luck with your search.{***}
Very well. I will continue my search.{***}
Excellent- good luck, {playername}.{***}
I have found the sword, Pallo.{***}
I have found the sword, Pallo. It glows with the blessing of the Lord of Faith.{***}
I am still looking- I will let you know if I make any progress.{***}
Tell me about the sword again.{***}
I was just passing by.{***}
The sword I seek was wielded by Atanos Giulien, the leader of the fledgeling Third Legion against the crusade of the Grazir Worshippers.{***}

Excuse me? Is this not the sword you have been looking for?{***}
No...most fascinating. The sword is all but the same in appearance, but this carries no blessing. It feels broken in all but its physical form.{***}
This is, however, a valuable artifact nonetheless. Would you let me keep it, so I could further study its essence? I could offer you a fair price.{***}
Very well, you can have the blade. I will continue my search for the true Aurora in the meantime.{***}
Sorry, but I would like to study the sword myself. I believe it will guide me to the true Aurora.{***}

Thank you, {playername}. If it is any help, I have been discussing this matter with some friends of the Legion. They believe the appearance of the blessed sword is linked somehow to the fate of our people. Perhaps our success could reveal its true form.{***}

Very well. If it is any help, I have been discussing this matter with some friends of the Legion. They believe the appearance of the blessed sword is linked somehow to the fate of our people. Perhaps our success could reveal its true form.{***}
Thank you, Pallo. I will keep you informed.{***}
(He examines the sword carefully)Wow, {playername}. This is it. Giulien's sword. I can feel the warmth of the Lord's blessing coursing through the metal.{***}

Take good care of it now- I feel the Lord of Faith has great plans for you.{***}

Hello. I am {playername}. Forgive me for saying so, but you look a bit ... strange in your attire. Who might you be?{***}
Good sir, I will answer you. We are the Pilgrims of the Old Perisnoan Empire. We hope one day a hero will rise to reclaim the empire. Might you be the one?{***}
Indeed, I am the one. I invite you to join me on my conquest to power. I will pay you an initial sum of {reg0} aurums.{***}

I was born about 29 years on a little island, about a 3 weeks journey from Perisno, where the names and architecture are of an old era.  Raised in a noble home, I was always over eager for adventure and battle. I was taught from age 7 to wield two handers and throwing weapons.{***}

I came to Perisno seeking adventure, and I had no idea that I would be the one giving others adventure. After coming to Perisno, I settled down and built an outpost - this very one, by myself. I raised my own personal army soon enough, with the help of some useful connections and loyal friends. However, local squabbling nobles attacked us and decimated us, even though we won. I hanged the foolish lords who did this. I realized that my life was not going anywhere, so I decided to set up the Freelancer Guild. We are basically mercenaries that are freelancers and help whoever pays us.{***}

Saudações, {amigo/amiga}. Você parece ser o tipo de {homem/pessoa} que se beneficiaria em me conhecer. Eu viajo muito por toda Calradia e mantenho os ouvidos bem abertos. Posso fornecer-lhe informações que você julgaria útil. Por um pequeno preço, é claro.

O que pode me dizer sobre esta terra?

Calradia está dividida entre reinos rivais que não conseguem viver em paz com os seus vizinhos, nem tampouco eliminá-los por completo. Como resultado, as amargas guerras que assolam esta terra e esgotam sua força vital se sucedem sem descanso. Bem, ao menos este deve ser um bom lugar para alguém com ânsias de aventuras como você. Com alguma sorte e habilidade, você pode fazer um nome aqui, acumular uma fortuna, ou talvez até mesmo ganhar um grande poder. As oportunidades são infinitas, assim como as recompensas, se aceitar arriscar sua vida por elas.
Conte-me mais sobre estas oportunidades.
Obrigad{o/a}. Isso é tudo o que eu precisava saber.
Bem, você provavelmente já sabe tudo o que posso lhe contar. Parece que vai muito bem.

Os reinos são capazes de pagar pequenas fortunas para tropas mercenárias quando encontram-se envolvidos em uma guerra. Se você tem um pouco de experiência comandando soldados, fale com algum nobre e não passará muito tempo sem que lhe ofereçam um contrato como mercenário. Contudo, a verdadeira recompensa chegará quando você conseguir se tornar vassalo de um rei. Um vassalo pode ser dono de aldeias, castelos e cidades, e enriquecem-se com os impostos e as rendas destas propriedades. Normalmente, apenas os nobres locais do reino alcançam tal posição, mas em tempos de guerra, nenhum rei hesitará em aceitar como vassalo alguém que se mostre merecedor de tais honrarias no campo de batalha, e lhe garantirá o direito de possuir terras.

Também não é inédito ouvir histórias de aventureiros que recusam-se a prestar vassalagem a qualquer rei Calradiano e autoproclamam-se reis, reclamando terras em seu próprio nome. Trata-se de um caminho árduo e cansativo... e mesmo entre os grandes nobres desta terra com suas linhagens ancestrais atrás deles, poucos estariam dispostos a aceitar um recém-chegado como seu monarca. Tais soberanos devem ser muito cuidadosos na hora de estabelecerem e consolidarem seu direito de governar, ou logo se encontrarão ameaçados por todas os lados possíveis.

Talvez seja mais fácil para um aventureiro como você prestar homenagem à causa de um dos rivais dos reis atuais. Há muitos desses pretendentes em Calradia... aqueles que nasceram nas famílias corretas, que podem sair por aí causando problemas ao dizer que eles têm maior direito ao trono do que o rei atual. Se os que fazem essas alegações encontrassem simpatizantes, poderiam começar facilmente uma guerra civil e, talvez, até mesmo substituir o rei algum dia.
Interessante. Onde posso encontrar os que fazem essas alegações?
Suponho que já ouvi o suficiente. Obrigad{o/a}.

Um pretendente ao trono estaria em perigo de morte em seu próprio país, naturalmente. Por esta razão, geralmente vivem nas cortes rivais acumulando apoios e confiando encontrar alguém que queira estabelecer-se como defensor de sua causa. A mim costumam chegar notícias de alguns deles, por isso poderia lhe dizer onde se encontram com certa precisão. Mas, obviamente, gostaria de receber alguma coisinha em troca de um serviço como esse.
Quero saber onde se encontra um pretendente.
De quem se trata?
Não importa.
Eu posso revelar-lhe esta informação por uma pequena quantia, digamos 30 denares.
Feito! Aqui estão os 30 denares.
Não importa.
{s15} se encontra agora mesmo em {s11}.
I want to know something about a person.{***}
About whom do you wish to hear?{***}
Rafklazan{***}

Ah.. funny you ask about that one. One of my associates was talking about him just the other day as well. Rafklazan is the leader of the Rafkla clan back in his homeland in Nisaynia, where he hails from. He likes to title himself as 'King.' They were raiding another clan, but somehow a wind blew them off course and they were blown away and scattered. For days they sailed until they reached Perisno. He is a formidable one, with a large army. You will need to be careful if you ever venture near Reich or Draharan lands, where he spends most of his time now, wandering around. Rafklazan himself is particularly dangerous. It is said he ripped apart a bear with his bare hands! Can you believe it? Yes, I think you will need to watch yourself if you ever face him in battle. {***}
Zeladeck{***}

Zeladeck, Illica's greatest Falki Knight was not an Illica to begin with. He was an orphan raised by a lumberjack couple , living in the forest near the mountain range of Illica. One day, he found a big injured Falki in the forest, and tended its wound. Nursing the everyday Falki for half a year, Zel and the Falki became best friend. The Falki then regained its strength, and took Zel to the Illica clan, only to reveal that that Falki is a direct descendant of the Sky King, the strongest and most respected Falki. He was 10 by that time. Zeladeck then was trained, and with his gifted ability of a warrior, plus the good teamwork between him and his Falki, he soon became the greatest Falki Knight only at the age of 19. Now, he thinks he is the Chosen One to lead the Falki to victory.{***}
Octiem{***}

Octiem is an odd one. He is the leader of the fabled Third Legion, who have long been a legend in Perisno. Hundreds of years ago, the Third Legion is said to have ruled the entire world. Octiem believes that he is the one to lead his men to victory, like his ancestors did. He proclaims himself as the one that was chosen to lead and rule the new empire. In reality, he is one delusional bastard who thinks only of himself and has ambitions that are beyond comprehension by the normal man (laughs). Anyway, little is known about him, and it is said that he was born to lead, raised by wolves after being abandoned as a baby. Should you ever fight him, be careful, for his army of loyal followers are very strong.{***}
Ral'Daiun.{***}

I do not know much about Ral'Daiun. It is said that his title is 'Ral,' and his real name is only Daiun. Ral supposedly means 'Legendary Leader' in the Assassins's wretched dialect. Ral'Daiun is a shadowy figure who have led his assassins to become a huge organization. They have no loyalties and kill for gold and gold only. You won't be seeing Ral'Daiun doing the killing the person, for his assassins do all the dirty work for him while he collects the money. He has a hidden castle somewhere in the mountains, but you will not find it for it is too well hidden. Years ago, the assassins were only a small organization, but now they seem to have quadrupled in size and number. You must be careful fighting them, for they have some new technology in their crossbows.{***}
Zolona{***}

Ah, Zolona. What can I say about her, hmm? She is the queen of her people, I am told, with the duty of a mountain upon her frail little shoulders. She acts brave and strong, but in reality, she is just a little girl without anyone to guide her. She is the daughter of the dead clan leader of the Syrin Nomads, and she has been chosen to lead her people to salvation. How she will do this is beyond me. You must be careful though, for her honor guard is very strong and can wield the bow better than even the Draharan camel riders. Should you meet her, know that while she is a hard enemy to defeat, she isn't invincible. Also, should you defeat her, remember to show her mercy, for even I feel sorry for her. You should, too.{***}
Ulfheonar.{***}

Ulfheonar is one of those cursed Volheere raiders. What's more, he is the leader of a large majority of them, and in particular the leader of those Volheere Berserkers. Now, you are young, reckless and headstrong. Word of advice -- don't go looking for Ulf. He and his men are all berserkers without a care or doubt about their own safety. If you fight him, you will most likely lose, and even if you win, you will lose many. Ulf was a Jarl back in Nisaynia where he came from. I think he was chosen as the leader of his people, sent to sail to a new land and populate it. I think he mistook 'populate' for loot and pillage, however, as thousands of men and women can gladly tell you. Now, anything else you would like to know?{***}
Nibor{***}

Nibor Hood is the leader of the Free-Men rebellion of Tolrania. They are rebelling because they think the Tolranian Government are hypocrites, and I say they are right! Even though I disagree with most of Nibor's methods, the government of Tolrania do need to change. Anyway, enough of me going off topic. Nibor was born and raised in a noble family like his sister, Lady Tylora. He grew sickened by all the flaws in the system and wanted a change. A republic, he said. We need to make Tolrania a republic, and fulfill our founders's wishes. Trouble is, you know what happens when someone wants to overthrow you, right? The King of Tolrania sent his men to kill Nibor, but he escaped, and ever since then he and a band of loyal followers have been wrecking havoc in Tolrania.{***}
Nobody.{***}
Have you heard anything interesting lately?{***}
I have not heard any other rumors lately. Perhaps another time.{***}
Very interesting. Goodbye.{***}

Adeus.
Saudações. Dizem que você é do tipo de {homem/mulher} que se interessaria em saber que eu viajo com frequência para {s17}. Lhe direi tudo o que sei por apenas 100 denares.
Aqui está... 100 denares. Diga-me o que sabe.

Bem, isso é tudo o que posso lhe dizer. Adeus.
Bom dia, {senhor/senhora}. Dará uma olhada em meus livros?
Sim. Mostre-me o que tem à venda.
Claro, {senhor/senhora}.

Nada. Obrigad{o/a}.
Saúdo-lhe cordialmente, {meu nobre senhor/minha nobre dama}.
O que posso fazer por você?
Tenho algumas dúvidas sobre o cortejo em Calradia.
Poderia ensinar-me alguns poemas?

Poderia lhe ensinar o poema "A Tormenta do Castelo do Amor". É um poema suficientemente curto, que pode ser aprendido facilmente. Poderia-se dizer que trata-se de um poema alegórico, repleto de símbolos e metáforas. Nele está descrito como um bravo guerreiro, embora um tanto abrupto, ganha o coração de uma dama ao aprender as virtudes da cavalaria, convertendo-se em um verdadeiro e nobre cavaleiro. Seu argumento, de que o papel de uma mulher é o de inspirar mas também o de civilizar um homem, é tido em alta estima por muitas damas nobres, embora não por todas.

Poderia lhe ensinar o poema "O Desejo do Coração". Trata-se de uma poesia lírica, que pode ser interpretada erótica ou espiritualmente. O amante toma consciência da majestosidade do divino contemplando o corpo de sua amada. Creio que este tipo de versos seduziria facilmente as mulheres com temperamento marcadamente romântico, mas corre o risco de escandalizar ou entediar outras.

Poderia lhe ensinar o conto de Kais e Layala. É uma história triste, mas sensível. O jovem pastor Kais e Layala, a filha de um nobre, se amam profundamente, mas não lhes permitem casar. O poema narra o lamento de Kais, como vagueia solitário, disposto a esquecer seu verdadeiro amor, mas ao mesmo tempo tornando-se louco de desejo. Algumas damas se derretem ante a doçura de suas sentenças, enquanto que outras desprezam tal autocompaixão em um homem.

Poderia lhe ensinar parte da saga de Helgerad e Kara. Trata-se de um conto épico, cheio de sangue e batalhas. A escudeira Kara elege o guerreiro Helgerad como seu amor, já que ele é o único homem capaz de derrotá-la em combate. Seu pai, que prometeu sua mão a outro cavaleiro, vai com seus filhos e huscarls para assassinar Helgerad. Ambos lutam, e Helgerad e Kara massacram toda a mesnada de seu pai, com exceção do seu amado irmão mais novo, que, desafortunadamente, crescerá cheio de rancor e buscará fazer Helgerad pagar pelo assassinato do seu idolatrado progenitor. A representação de um guerreiro e uma donzela escudeira como iguais despertará o interesse de algumas mulheres, mas a exibição da heroína salpicada de sangue no meio de uma batalha repugnará outras.

Poderia lhe ensinar a poesia "Uma Discussão nos Jardins". É um poema cômico, que satiriza as convenções do amor cortês. Um amante rouba em um jardim de Veluca e presta homenagem à dama com dezenas de versos engenhosos para persuadir o seu amor de que lhe permita tomá-la em seus braços. Ela joga por terra todos os seus avanços, um a um, até que ele termina abatido, então ela o toma em seus braços e diz que o quis durante todo o tempo, apenas em seus próprios termos, não nos dele. Uma dama com senso de humor poderá achar este poema altamente divertido, mas outras podem sentir que se trata de uma zombaria inapropriada.
Para ensinar-lhe a recitá-lo, precisarei de algumas horas do seu tempo e, claro, uma pequena cota por meus serviços. Uns 300 denares devem ser suficientes.
Creio que já conhece todos os poemas que poderia lhe ensinar.
Sim... quero aprender este.
Não importa.
Muito bem... repita comigo:^^Desviei seus dardos de dúvidas,^Com minha armadura de pura devoção,^Forjada no martelo de minhas entranhas,^Bem longe de qualquer baixa emoção.

Muito bem... repita comigo:^^Sois vós a primeira e última,^A inalcançável e a mais próxima.^Quando provo o copo de seu amor,^Escapo mais além do tempo,^Pois um momento a sós com você,^Não deveria ter nem princípio nem fim.

Bem... repita depois de mim:^^O vento que levanta a poeira da estepe,^Agita as cortinas de sua torre.^A lua que ilumina minha embriagada volta para casa,^Vigia seus sonhos empoleirados.^Acaso se gritasse ao vento,^Poderia lhe chegar a mensagem de meus lábios?^Se chorasse ante a lua,^Me permitiria vê-la de novo?

Muito bem... repita comigo:^^Uma luz atravessou os rochedos de Wercheg em sua obscuridade...^Onde a feroz carga de uma onda se quebrou contra a costa.^Elmos cinzentos, escudos cinzentos, emergidos em verdade,^Cavalo na proa, lonas quebradas,^Sobre os rugidos dos remos e as madeiras,^Ela gritou a seus irmãos... vestidos para a guerra.

Perfeito... então repita depois de mim:^^Todas as sedas de Veluca, todas as peles de Khudan,^Não poderiam comprar seu mais breve beijo,^Que eu lhe peço, lhe peço por amor,^E pelo bem da minha felicidade.^Mas lhe ofereço um presente? Mostre-o! Mostre-o!^Ou acaso deveria contar a meu pai que veio me ver?
Desviei seus dardos de dúvidas...
Sois vós a primeira e última...
O vento que levanta a poeira da estepe...
Uma luz atravessou os rochedos de Wercheg em sua obscuridade...
Todas as sedas de Veluca...
Pfff... Que tipo de sonatas são essas?

Muito bem. Se o poema não {o/a} agrada, então guarde seu dinheiro. Mas lembre-se... com poetas e com amores, o importante não é agradar a si mesmo. O que importa é agradar a sua audiência. Caso deseje conhecer a poesia, ainda estou disposto a ensiná-la.
Muito bem... mas ainda há muitos versos para aprender. Agora, escute com atenção...
Pode me contar algo sobre as donzelas solteiras do reino?
Sobre quem deseja saber?
Simplesmente conte-me os últimos rumores.
Não importa.
{reg0?Ela é casada:Ele é casado} com você, é claro! Claramente ninguém sonharia que {reg0?ela:ele} faria qualquer coisa para engendrar fofocas.
Muito interessante, mas vamos falar de outra coisa.
Muito interessante, há mais alguma notícia?
Quê?! Mostrarei a esse vilão a minha espada!
O que você quer dizer? O {s11} será obrigado a lhe enfrentar, mas desafiar a duelo um nobre pelo coração de uma dama é visto pelas pessoas de bem como um impulso exaltado, mesmo em tempos de guerra.
Sim... eu tenho a intenção de obrigar o {s11} a renunciar suas pretensões sobre {s12}!
Não... eu deixarei que minhas paixões se consumam dentro de mim.
Como quiser. Difundirei suas pretensões, assim {s13} não poderá voltar atrás...

Adeus.
O que deseja saber?
Poderia lhe responder alguma outra pergunta?
Há lugar para alguém como eu na arte do amor?
Como um pretendente poderia conhecer uma dama digna?
Após conhecer uma donzela, como posso conquistá-la como nobre pretendente?
Fale-me sobre o matrimônio e o amor na nobreza calradiana.

A nobreza é uma classe muito peculiar. Em Calradia, uma filha representa um importante valor político a ser dado a um nobre com quem seu pai queira estabelecer uma aliança. No entanto, as grandes famílias desta terra idealizam o amor verdadeiro entre um homem e uma mulher, e de fato tenho visto muitos bravos guerreiros chorarem copiosas lágrimas ardentes de paixão, como nas canções de Sahira e Janun, em que ele conspira para partir o coração de sua própria filha.

Há pais de toda índole, é claro. Alguns nobres calradianos permitirão a suas filhas escolher um marido de sua preferência. Outros, porém, consideram que permitir a suas filhas qualquer escolha à margem de sua decisão diminuiria sua autoridade frente a todos, e as imporão um prometido quer elas gostem ou não.

Mas a maioria está no meio termo. Desejarão tomar a decisão final sobre o noivo, mas não exercerão uma pressão excessiva nas preferências de suas filhas. Dentre outras razões, porque um matrimônio feliz implica em uma maior possibilidade de produzir herdeiros. Portanto, há lugar para o amor na nobreza, bem como para o uso do subterfúgio e da paixão na hora de se ganhar o coração de uma dama.
E quando uma donzela e seu pai estão em desacordo sobre um pretendente?

Às vezes pode acontecer de a noiva fugir. Isto é um golpe duríssimo para o prestígio de seu pai, que sem dúvida geraria uma duradoura inimizade entre ele e o amante de sua filha. De fato, é possível que se desencadeie uma guerra por causa de uma mulher apaixonada. Isso certamente seria um bom argumento para uma canção.

No final, no entanto, a maioria das noivas subordinará sua decisão às palavras de seus pais. A família é tudo para uma dama nobre, e poucas são suficientemente corajosas, ou apaixonadas, para arriscar sua honra pela felicidade de um homem que mal conhecem. Sem amores acabados em tragédias... sobre o que teríamos que cantar?

Claro! Os lordes calradianos desejam manter suas linhagens puras a seu gosto, mas no final, as terras e a riqueza valem muito mais que qualquer antepassado. Por isso, mesmo que você seja estrangeiro, se for capaz de ascender em sua posição social, muitos pais o considerarão um bom partido.

Você terá que competir com muitos outros lordes do reino e eles terão uma clara vantagem... já que conheceram estas damas desde a infância e foram preparados como dignos pretendentes na perspectiva das mães e tias mais exigentes. Algumas donzelas, contudo, poderiam ver-se fascinadas pelo desconhecido.

Mas saiba que você pode acabar com o coração partido em mil pedaços se permanecer gostando de um par de olhos bonitos... e nobres. Mas entrar no campo do amor temendo o fracasso é como entrar no campo de batalha com medo das flechas do inimigo. Seja corajoso, ignore o risco da rejeição, e a vitória será sua.

Milady, vou lhe falar sem rodeios. A maior parte dos nobres destas terras em idade de pretender, buscam para si donzelas recatadas, cuja pele seja tão bela e pura como a neve virgem, mas a sua está queimada pelo sol. Eles querem uma jovem cuja voz seja suave como os sinos, e a sua está rouca de tanto gritar aos homens em meio a batalha. Além disso, ainda que os lordes calradianos apreciem os poemas de amor, o que a maioria querem são herdeiros... e poucas mulheres seriam capazes de cavalgar e guerrear enquanto cuidam de suas campanhas.

No entanto, nem todos os lordes possuem uma mente tão fechada. Nós, poetas, cantamos para as donzelas escudeiras e para as caçadoras, para as mulheres que forjaram seu próprio caminho sem ter tido que sacrificar as oportunidades que trouxe o amor. Eu não afirmo que vai ser fácil para você encontrar um marido devoto que aceite sua condição, mas também não digo que é impossível.
Quais as vantagens de se encontrar {uma esposa/um marido}?

Ah! Você é puramente romântico, já vejo! Bom, além dos óbvios benefícios do amor, como o companheirismo e outros em... questões de quarto, contrair matrimônio entre a nobreza proporciona grandes benefícios. Você forja uma sólida aliança com a família da noiva e, claro, uma dama de bem sempre poderá ajudá-lo a lidar com os assuntos políticos do reino.

E mais, a maioria das grandes famílias nobres de Calradia estão relacionadas em maior ou menor grau com a realeza, o que aumentaria a legitimidade de suas próprias reivindicações para governar... se é que você pretende tal coisa...

Ah! Você é puramente romântica, já vejo! Bom, além dos óbvios benefícios do amor, como o companheirismo e outros em... questões de quarto, contrair matrimônio entre a nobreza proporciona grandes benefícios. Você terá acesso à administração dos castelos e demais propriedades de seu marido, e além disso poderá colaborar com ele para enaltecer e consolidar juntos sua posição no reino.

De vez em quando, o rei ou algum nobre importante celebrará uma festa. Nas cidades, elas muitas vezes coincidem com importantes torneios, e nos castelos vêm acompanhadas de partidas de caça. Os banquetes oferecem a oportunidade de que os nobres rompam suas rivalidades políticas, que poderiam acabar comprometendo a unidade do reino. E também proporcionam às famílias uma oportunidade para apresentar em sociedade suas filhas em idade de casamento, permitindo inclusive que as jovens damas se relacionem sem restrições com os convidados.

Quando tiver a oportunidade, você pode tentar entreter uma dama com um elogio. Isto a indicará que você é um potencial pretendente, e geralmente em seguida você saberá se ela está interessada para que possa continuar com o seu cortejo. A propósito, se você for à festa depois de ter se destacado em um torneio ou em uma caçada, causará a melhor das primeiras impressões.

Cortejar uma dama requer tempo e paciência, além de vários encontros ao longo de alguns meses. Uma dama que esteja interessada em você frequentemente encontrará uma maneira de fazê-lo saber do seu desejo de que vá visitá-la. Do mesmo modo, você poderá ir diretamente ao pai ou irmão dela e perguntar se eles lhe dão sua permissão para festejar com ela. Ainda assim, se não contar com a autorização de seu protetor, sempre é possível marcar um encontro mediante outros meios.

Após marcar um encontro, você deverá tentar seduzi-la e ganhar seu favor. Talvez uma das coisas mais difíceis disto tudo seja encontrar um tema de conversa apropriado. A maioria das mulheres da nobreza calradiana levam uma vida de clausura, pelo menos até que contraiam matrimônio... e por isso tendem a ter pouco o que dizer de interessante. Além disso, ela em breve poderia cansar-se de escutar sobre suas aventuras no mundo exterior.

Um bom método de abordagem pode ser recitar um poema popular, e conversar sobre ele. Desta forma você falará com ela em pé de igualdade, sem vantagens quanto ao conhecimento ou a experiência no campo. Claro, donzelas diferentes também possuem gostos distintos a respeito de poesias da corte.

Em algum momento, você será capaz de expor abertamente o assunto do matrimônio. Então, ela lhe fará saber se o considera à altura do que ela esperaria de um marido. Algumas donzelas avaliarão friamente qual o mais valioso de seus pretendentes, enquanto que outras simplesmente se deixarão levar pela paixão. Algumas também observarão seus companheiros, para ver se você é do tipo de marido que se unirá a ela como um igual, enquanto que outras tentarão seguir o exemplo de seus pais.

Em todo caso, trata-se de um desafio... e além disso não se esqueça de que, ainda que consiga fazer seu romance com uma dama prosperar, em breve você poderia ter que lidar com as ambições políticas do pai dela. Por isso, você deve se perguntar seriamente... está disposto a arriscar-se à decepção e à dor? Ou inclusive... estaria disposto a desfazer-se de sua posição social e a converter seus aliados em inimigos em prol de um amor proibido? Porque se assim for, talvez um dia escrevamos poemas sobre você.
A que se dedica exatamente os músicos e poetas como você?

Componho e escrevo canções para os senhores destas terras e para suas nobres esposas. Às vezes canto sobre a guerra, às vezes sobre as virtudes dos reis... e em algumas ocasiões, para o público mais sofisticado, sobre as virtudes do vinho. Para a maioria das audiências, no entanto, canto sobre o amor.
Não, isso é tudo.
Tem alguma outra pergunta?
Algo mais?
Greetings, friend. Is there anything you need?{***}
Who are you?{***}

I am a member of the Entertainment Guild. Our guildsmen travel around Perisno's taverns, and offer our services to those who wish it -- for a price, of course. We provide entertainment to the travel-weary, or to people who just want to relax and enjoy.{***}
I see. Would you be able to provide my men and I entertainment if I asked for it?{***}
Certainly! We take requests from any who want it. I'm sure your party's morale will be high once I am finished.{***}
Well, that's good to know. I'll think about it.{***}

Actually, I wish to know about the Masnerian Knights.{***}

We are trained from an early age in our Order castle, and sent outside to the world to become mercenaries. Our leader is called Lord Ceylius the Dishonorable, the one who inherited the title of Grandmaster of the Masnerian Knights from his father before him. Welcome to the Mercenary Guild, traveller. How can I help you?{***}

What is this place?{***}
We call ourselves Mercenary Guild. My name is Ingvar and I am the head of the Guild.{***}
Here come people from all over the world who for one reason or another abandoned their old life and decided to start anew.{***}

Some of them left their masters, some of the ran from a war they didn't want to fight. Farmers who want to become warriors, outlaws sick of their former lives, religious people who became disillusioned with their faith.{***}

We all here have different stories, different backgroud, different training. You can walk around and talk to guys - some of them might decide to join you... provided you can afford to pay for their service, of course.{***}

Finally, it might interest you that although most people here prefer to stick to their old weapons and trainings, there are always volunteers who I train personally to be good with different weapons - whether it is a shortbow or a longbow, a sword or a mace. Therefore you can equip them however you want, and they won't mind, though more costly equipment will naturally raise their upkeep.{***}

Claro que sim. Eu sou um soldado veterano... Lutei em muitas guerras no meu tempo, mas hoje em dia treino jovens novatos nesta área. Posso lhe encontrar alguns oponentes para praticar, se quiser.
